He is married, and this business allows him to cover all the needs of his four children. Currently, he needs to buy a new embroidering machine to be able to expand his business. He also wants to buy four rolls of thread. For these reasons, he's requesting a loan from WAGES.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy embroidering machines and sewing thread

loans.name: Zumrat

texts.ru: Зумрат Бекназарова проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 49 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж вместе сыном работают на земле. Сама же Зумрат вместе с дочерью занимается торговлей. Она имеент магазин, где торгует продуктами питания. Кредит просит для увеличения товараборота.
texts.en:
49-year-old Zumrat B. lives in the Yavana district with her husband and four children. Her husband and son work the land together. For her part, Zumrat is engaged with her daughter in retail. She has a store where she sells food products. The loan is requested in order to expand her inventory.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand inventory

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 50 years old and married with two children. She sells provisions and has been in the business for the past eight years.

Victoria hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina D., 58, of Barrio Bagong Pag-asa, Pasay City, has been known for her sweet banana cue for three decades now. Her husband Antonio, 64, is a family driver, and they have seven children. Marcelina has spent half of her life cooking and selling sweet caramelized bananas skewered in thin bamboo sticks. She is so used to her daily routine that she says she could even cook with her eyes closed. Earning more than P10,000.00 a month, she uses her profits for the family’s daily needs.

Marcelina joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She recently applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P14,000.00 as additional capital for her banana cue business. She dreams of having other types of businesses or jobs to do other than selling banana cue.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: Additional capital for banana cue business

loans.name: Kurbonbi

texts.ru: Гулова Курбонби проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 46 лет. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж работает строителем на стройке. Сама Курбонби более 4 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота. На полученную прибыль хочет отремонтировать свой дом.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Sda Primary School, Magburaka Group

texts.en:
These are teachers of the SDA Primary School in Magburaka town. The school was founded in 1958 by the Seventh Day Adventist Mission. Today, it has a total of 392 pupils with a staff of ten teachers and administrators. The school is proud that they almost always earn a 98-100% pass rate on the National Primary School Exams (NPSE).

Teachers of the SDA Primary School, Magburaka, are applying for a loan of Le 7,500,000 from Kiva Lenders through SMT. With this loan, some of the staff members will start a small business and those who are already running small businesses will invest the loan into their business. Some of the staff members will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to pay either for their children’s education or pay for themselves to pursue further studies. Others will use their loan in home-building projects.

Sixty-two year old William B. C. (back row, third from left) is the head teacher at the school. William has been a teacher since 1964. He was born in Yelle village about thirty-three miles from Magburaka town, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with ten children. Eight of his children are already grown-ups and the other two are in colleges. Mr. C. will give his loan to his wife to invest in her business. She sells market food.

loans.use: To invest in his wife's business

loans.name: Vero

texts.en: Vero, 57 years old and married with five children, bakes and sells cakes. In this business since 1979, she hopes for the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more baking material. Vero says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking material

loans.name: Rajabali

texts.ru: Назаров Рачабали проживает в районе Явана. Возраст 49 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Рачабали более 3 лет занимается откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота и увеличения товараборота, т.к. этот вид бизнеса является единственным источником дохода.

loans.use: Покупка скота

loans.name: Khaldé Fothy 1 Group

texts.fr: Nous sommes un groupement de femmes qui habite l'écovillage d'Oussouye et qui possédons des boutiques de vente en détail de toute sorte d'article qui puissent intéressés les femmes de notre villages et des populations environnementales qui vivent dans les alentours. Nous avons donc un grand groupe que nous avons divisé en deux groupes; Un groupe est chargé de commercialiser les produits alimentaires , tandis que notre groupe est chargé de vendre des produits d'équipement(ustensiles de cuisine) et de toilette(produits cosmétiques). C'est pour pouvoir ravitailler notre boutique que nous sommes venues solliciter un prêt auprès de votre institution. Ceci nous permettra de mettre à la disposition des populations locales des produits à la portée et à moindre coût que celui pratiqué dans les grandes villes. Cela permettre aussi de créer des emplois réels et fixes pour les filles du village.

loans.use: Achat de produits de première nécessité ( ustensiles de cuisine, tissus teints et cosmétiques

loans.name: Genemilda

texts.en:
Genemilda F., 58 years old, resides in Malibay, Pasay City, where her husband Primitivo, 60, works as an apartment caretaker. Like all working women, she is trying to provide a better life for their only child who is in grade school. Genemilda works everyday sewing and making clothes for all types of people, a business she has operated for the last 30 years. Specializing in school and office uniforms, she also sells sewing items such as buttons, needles, threads, fabrics, and other products. Assisted by her sister, she earns at least P7,000.00 a month.

Genemilda is asking for a loan in the amount of P12,000.00 in order to buy more products for making clothing. She counts on regular clients who are very satisfied with her work, and she strives to put forth her best efforts in order to improve the situation of her family. She hopes to open a big boutique so that she can hire more people and be of help to others.

About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more products for making clothing

loans.name: Fakonam

texts.fr: Cette femme est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de qualités. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2005 et ce commerce lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Grâce à son expérience, elle a beaucoup de clients fidèles. Actuellement elle doit renouveler son stock ; pour cette raison, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 04 pièces de pagnes Hitarget, 04 pièces de pagnes phoenix, 04 pièces de pagnes Fashion et 04 pièces de pagnes Holywood.
texts.en:
This is a woman who goes door-to-door selling quality pagnes (colorful West African cloth).  She started doing this work in 2005.  It's a business that allows her to provide for their two children.  Thanks to her experience, she has many loyal customers.  Currently, she must renew her inventory.  For this reason, she's requesting a loan from WAGES to buy 4 bolts of Hitarget pagnes, 4 of Phoenix, 4 of Fashion, and 4 of Holywood.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy quality cloth

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane sells cooked foods and has been in the business since 1999. She is 36 years old and married with three children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria.

Jane hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex is 36 years old and married with a child. He sells provisions and has been in the business for the past ten years.

Alex hopes for the loan of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Love

texts.en: Love, 40 years old and married with six children, sells provisions. She has been in this business for the past four years and is requesting the loan amount of N170,000 to purchase more provisions to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: David

texts.en: David sells fish and has been in the business for the past 4 years. He is 38years old and married with 2 children. He is requesting for the loan amount of N120, 000 to purchase more fish to sell. he says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Justine Kimutai

texts.en:
Justine K. is 34 years old and married with two children. He has been in the retail business for the past two years now and his retail is located in Chembulet center in Eldoret Town.

Justine was introduced to KADET by a member and with the loan he has applied for he intends to buy sugar, rice and cooking fat.

Justine believes he is hardworking and his future intentions are to open a wholesale shop and buy a plot big enough for farming.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: Adding more stock for his retail business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma C. is 37 years old CEVI client from Talibon Bohol. Before her first loan in CEVI it was difficult to start a business. Now, she is a boat operator where she earn income from passengers who keep going to their small island. 

She requested a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to have a boat repair. 

She said she likes CEVI policies especially that they are offering the lowest interest rate which is 2% a month.

loans.use: having a boat repair

loans.name: Bienvenida

texts.en:
Bienvenida P. has been a CEVI client for quite a long time now. She is on her 7th loan in CEVI because she is happy with its services and with the staff who implement the program. She has seven children: three girls and four boys who are all studying.

Bienvenida needs additional capital to support her business which is selling fish. She wants to buy a new boat engine and needs Php 12,000 to purchase it. Receiving this loan will also help her to send all her children to school and to buy some of their needs.

loans.use: To buy a boat engine

loans.name: Lona

texts.en:
Lona E. is currently in the business of selling bread, sweet patatoes, beans, etc. and is requesting a loan to stock more beans to sell. Thirty years old and married to a businessman, she has three children, all attending school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beans to sell

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: Adelina, de 30 años, es una madre trabajadora muy abnegada por sus 4 hijos, vive en su casa propia con su esposo e hijos. Ella es de una comunidad nativa (ashaninka) y a pesar de hablar castellano, también mantiene intacto su idioma, pero ha cambiado la pesca y caza de animales de campo por el cultivo de café y plátanos. Esta actividad la realiza en compañía de su esposo, lo cual le es muy placentero, ya que de ese modo se acompañan y se ayudan mutuamente. Para la comercialización, su esposo se encarga de llevar el café hasta una empresa acopiadora (la recolectora más importante de la ciudad) donde la pagan un buen precio por su producto, lo que le permite recuperar lo invertido. Mientras tanto, Adelina continúa con la recolección de los granos, ya que los meses de cosecha son claves para recaudar mayor cantidad de dinero para comprar los comestibles de la familia en grandes cantidades, para que los siguientes meses no tengan carencias alimenticias; aprovechando también para comprar vestimentas a sus hijos, lo cual la hace muy feliz. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser una cliente muy puntual, por ello le tienen mucho aprecio todos los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará fertilizantes químicos para el abonado de sus cafetales y de ese modo asegure su próxima cosecha.

loans.use: Compra de fertilizantes

loans.name: Diego

texts.en: Diego T. is 39 years old fisherman and father of 5 children. His eldest son is 19 years old on October and he really likes the services offered by Community Economic Ventures Inc. By availing another loan in CEVI, he hopes to buy fishing materials and boat engine since those that he used are already old. With this loan, he will also be able to send his children to school and provide some of their needs at home.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials and boat engine

loans.name: Job

texts.es: Job tiene 37 años, es padre soltero, vive en la casa de su madre con su hijo de 4 años. Desde muy joven su actividad diaria son las plantaciones de plátanos y piñas, pero en los últimos años ha preferido disminuir sus siembras de piña, debido a la alta inversión que necesita. Por ello, se ha dedicado mayormente a los plátanos, producto que le es más rentable y le proporciona ganancias cada semana. Ahora Job quiere incrementar sus plantaciones, pues tiene sus ventas aseguradas, ya que los compradores vienen hasta sus chacras y él se evita de llevar sus productos al mercado, resultándole esta metodología, muy conveniente. De esta manera, Job puede solventar los gastos diarios de su familia, en especial de su pequeño hijo, quien es su mayor preocupación. Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y por el cual se compromete a pagar puntualmente, tal como lo hizo en el ciclo pasado, así no perjudicará a su banco comunal. El dinero que viene solicitando lo usará en la compra de nuevas plantas de plátano, para de ese modo incrementar su producción.
texts.en:
Job, 37, is a single father. He lives in his mother’s house with his four year old son. Since he was very young, his daily activity has been with banana and pineapple crops. In the last few years he has decreased his pineapple planting due to the high investment required. He has devoted himself primarily to bananas. This product is more profitable, and it gives him income every week. Job now wants to increase his planting; his sales are assured. His buyers come to his fields, and he avoids having to take his products to the market. This method is very convenient. This way Job is able to pay the daily family expenses, especially for his young son who is his major concern. This is his second loan with MFP. He promises to pay punctually as he did in the last loan cycle. That way he will not hurt his community bank. The money he is asking for will be used to buy new banana plants to increase his production.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy banana plants

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es: A sus 27 años, Rosmery muestra laboriosidad y tenacidad para sus cultivos, tiene un hijo y el segundo por nacer. Ella vive en su casa propia, en su pueblo Picoy, a media hora de la ciudad de Tarma. A pesar de su embarazo Rosmery viene cultivando, cosechando y también ordeñando diariamente sus vacas para vender la leche en el mercado de la ciudad. Pero sus mayores ingresos económicos se dan a través de sus cultivos de hortalizas, por ello no descuida de cultivar y regar sus siembras y como resultado logra cosechar en tan sólo 3 meses los productos esperados, como las zanahorias. Cuando va recogiendo sus productos, también los va seleccionado de acuerdo al tamaño y lavando en la acequia de su pueblo, para que posteriormente, generalmente los días martes a las tres de la madrugada, los lleva hasta el mercado más importante de la ciudad de Tarma, donde elige a los compradores que le ofrezcan los mejores precios. Por ello, a Rosmery le gusta sembrar todo tipo de hortalizas, ya que le permite recaudar dinero en corto plazo. Este es su treceavo préstamo con MFP y en ninguno de sus créditos anteriores se demoró en pagar sus cuotas. Además, cuando las reuniones de su grupo tocan en su casa, Rosmery prepara el típico plato “picante de cuy”, con el fin de compartir con todos sus compañeros de su banco comunal, a quienes estima mucho. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita comprará fertilizantes químicos y semillas de zanahorias para el incremento de su producción.
texts.en:
At 27 years old, Rosmery cultivates her crops with diligence and tenacity. She has one child and a second child who is due any day. She lives in the town of Picoy in her own house, one-half hour from the city of Tarma. Despite her pregnancy, she cultivates and harvests her crops and also tends to her cows daily and sells the milk in the city market. The majority of her income is derived from the cultivation of vegetables; therefore, she does not fail to cultivate and water her seedlings, and, as a result, harvests in only three months the expected produce, such as carrots. When she harvests her produce, she also sorts it by size and washes it in the irrigation ditch of her town, so that later, generally on Tuesdays at three in the afternoon, she takes it to the most important market in the city of Tarma, where it is chosen by the buyers who pay the best prices. For this reason, Rosmery likes to sow all types of vegetables which permit her to profit in a short period of time. This is her thirteenth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma, and she has never been late in making payments on her previous loans. In addition, when it is her turn to host her group in her house, she prepares the traditional spicy meat stew to share with her companions in the cooperative bank, who she holds in high esteem. With the requested $350, she will buy chemical fertilizers and carrot seeds to increase production.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers and seeds

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en: Nadia J. is currently in the business of selling local alcohol and is requesting a loan to purchase brewing materials. She is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a peasant. She has two children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a bar. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more brewing materials

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
El Sr. eduardo A. C. tiene 32 años, esta casado nueve años con la Sra. Norah Cadima, tienen 2 hijos los cuales acuden a la escuela de la zona, tienen casa propia.

Trabajan con sus vacas lecheras todos los dias, entregan toda la produccion a una microempresa, la cual elabora queso, el sr. Eduardo por las tardes trabaja como taxista y ocasionalmente por las noches. 
Requieren del dinero para poder comprar una cabeza de ganado lechero, esto ayudara a incrementar sus ingresos para poder mejorar la casa y tambien para poder darles a sus hijos una mejor educacion y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
El Sr. (Mr.) Eduardo A. C. is 32 years old. He has been married to la Sra. (Mrs.) Norah Cadima for nine years. They own their home and have two children who attend the local school. They work with dairy cows every day and deliver the production to a small business which makes cheese. El Sr. Eduardo drives a taxi in the afternoon and also occasionally at night. They require the money to buy a dairy cow, which would increase their income. With more income, they would be able to make improvements to their house and also give their children a better education and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es: Zulma es una joven madre muy trabajadora, tiene 35 años, vive en la casa de su madre y desde que nació su hija Danitza, de un año, viene afrontado sola sus responsabilidades. Anteriormente se dedicaba a diversas actividades, desafortunadamente en ninguna le fue bien, hasta que su tío, de profesión agrónomo y dueño de una tienda de fertilizantes le traspasó ese negocio con la finalidad de que ella le pague fraccionadamente en un determinado tiempo. Desde entonces, Zulma le ha puesto mucho empeño y dedicación a su trabajo, comprendiendo que el trato a sus clientes es algo muy importante en un negocio. Por ello, es muy amable con todas las personas que visitan su tienda y con el pasar del tiempo han aflorado sus habilidades de persuasión y convencimiento para la venta. En el transcurso de este tiempo ha notado que ha ganado muchos clientes, en especial de las zonas netamente agrícolas, donde se consume mayor cantidad de fertilizantes y pesticidas. Es por esta razón Zulma acude a un nuevo crédito con MFP, siendo el treceavo préstamo que tiene, demostrando ser una cliente muy responsable en sus pagos, más aun en su cargo de tesorera de su banco comunal. Los mil quinientos nuevos soles que viene solicitando, los invertirá para el incremento de su capital de trabajo.
texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Zulma is a hard-working, young mother. She lives in a house with her mother and since her one-year-old daughter Danitza was born, she has faced her responsibilities alone. Previously, she engaged in various activites, but, unfortunately, she had no success until her uncle, an agronomist and owner of a farm supply store, transferred the business to her with an agreement that she make installment payments to him over a specified period of time. Since then, Zulma has put much effort and dedication into her work; she understands that customer service is very important in business. Therefore, she is very kind to everyone who visits her store and, with the passage of time, her ability to persuade and to make a sale has surfaced. In this time period, she has noticed that she has acquired many customers, especially from areas that are actually agricultural, where a large quantity of fertilizers and pesticides are used. For this reason, Zulma has turned to Microfinanzas Prisma for her thirteenth loan. She has been very responsible with her past payments and, additionally, in her position as treasurer of her cooperative bank. The five hundred twenty-five dollars she is requesting will be used to increase her business capital.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of business capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: This is Erlinda A., a 47-year-old fruit vendor from Silang, Cavite. Her husband, Virgilio, 54, is a farmer and a part-time driver. They have six children, three of whom are already earning a living and helping their other siblings with their school expenses (as such is the custom in the Philippines). Erlinda has a fruit stand along the National Highway. She buys fruit from farmers and traders and sells them to locals and foreign tourists who frequent their place. She earns a net income of P20,000 a month. She uses her profits for the education of her children and for the daily basic needs of her family. Erlinda has been in the business for two years. She started it just when she joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She is now on her 8th loan. Erlinda needs a loan of P15,000 as additional capital to expand her business. She dreams of buying their own passenger jeepney (a small bus) for her husband. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria S. is currently in the business of selling beer in the bar and is requesting a loan to stock more beers to sell. Victoria is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a butcher. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house to rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more beers to sell

loans.name: Eliud Chege

texts.en:
Eliud N. is a dairy farmer. Eliud sells milk to the traders in his center and his neighbors. He is married with two children. He lives in Kibiciku, a small center on the outskirts of Nairobi.

Eliud was introduced to KADET by a friend; he has never borrowed from other sources. This will be his second loan and he plans to buy more cows so that he will be able to supply many shops and traders. He wants to add at least six to ten cows. With that, he believes his business volume will definitely increase and he will double his profits.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows for milk production

loans.name: Honorato

texts.en:
Honorato P. is 62 years old. Four of his six children are married already and his new purpose now is to give his two grandchildren a good future by providing them allowances when they attend school.

Honorato is a fisherman and fish is the bread and butter in their family. Currently he is in his 3rd loan in CEVI. He requested a loan because he needs to buy new fishing equipment. Some of the loan will also be used to start a business to augment their income. 

Honorato said CEVI is a great program because it helps a lot of people like him.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en: Lilia A., 58, believes in the popular adage that “there is wealth in garbage”. She has been a widow for years and lives with her three children in Sun Valley, Parañaque City. Lilia has been a garbage collector for five years now and is proud of it. Lilia’s work and source of livelihood is maybe menial to some but for her it is her source of wealth. She collects garbage by making daily rounds from village to village mounted on her pedicab, fetching each household’s rubbish. Before dumping everything in the city’s waste disposal facility, she salvages anything recyclable and of value and turns it into cash by bringing it to a junk shop. After she’s done with her daily routine, she tends her sari-sari (general) store where she sells toys and other fun items for children. She earns more than P15,000 a month from these activities. Lilia joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2004. Her previous loans with the cooperative have been a big help in her business. She was able to purchase an additional pedicab which she uses in garbage collection. She now employs the services of one of her sons. Lilia applied for a new loan with CCT in the amount of P36,000 to purchase a bigger pedicab for the expansion of her garbage collection operations. She also plans to use some of the loan proceeds for the renovation of their house. It has been Lilia’s long sought after dream to have her own house and lot including her own junk shop. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To purchase a bigger pedicab for the expansion of her garbage collection business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn N. is a fish vendor and her husband is a fisherman. She works from 8 a.m. - 5 p.m. everyday to sell fish. She has seven children and is expecting to have a new baby, her 8th child, this coming September 2009. Her dream for her children is for them to be able to graduate from college so that they will know how to manage their lives well.

Obtaining a loan from CEVI will be really helpful in buying fishing equipment that Jocelyn’s husband needs. Some of the loan will also be utilized to buy a new boat.

Jocelyn likes CEVI so much for it gives her not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment for her husband and a new boat

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José tiene 51 años, vive junto a sus 2 hijos, con quienes asumió el rol de padre y madre debido a la separación con su pareja. Su deseo de educar a sus hijos lo llevó a consolidar su propio taller de cerrajería, en el cual trabaja hace más de 10 años. Se inició con el apoyo de algunos amigos quienes le ayudaron a conseguir su primeros clientes y ahora ya tiene 2 talleres y un buen número de clientes, quienes solicitan sus servicios con frecuencia. Esta actividad le permite mejorar sus ingresos económicos, es por ello que una de sus metas es instalar sus talleres de cerrajería en zonas comerciales de su localidad donde le generen mayores ganancias. Pero para lograrlo trata de estar muy pendiente de sus dos locales, contando con el apoyo de sus hijos y su padre. Por tal motivo, para mejorar la calidad de su labor requiere de varias herramientas que espera modernizar, ya que las que posee ahora están gastadas. Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA por lo que compromete a ser responsable con sus pagos y con la institución. Los 2500 soles que viene solicitando le permitirán comprar los materiales necesarios para realizar los acabados de los últimos trabajos que tiene por entregar.
texts.en:
José is 51 years old. He lives together with his two sons, with whom he has assumed the role of father and mother owing to his separation from his wife. His dream to educate his children led him to put together his own locksmith's shop, in which he has worked for more than 10 years. He began the shop with the support of some friends, who helped him to get his first customers. He now has two shops and a good number of customers who frequently solicit his services. This profession enables him to continue improving his economic income, and it is for this reason that one of his goals is to install his locksmith's shops in commercial zones, where the shops' locations would generate increased earnings. However, in order to achieve this goal, he must keep a watchful eye on his two locations; to help him try to do this, he relies on the assistance of his sons and father to keep the shops running smoothly. To be able to expand, he must improve the quality of the labor at his shops. To do this, he requires various tools that he has been waiting to modernize, since the ones he has are all worn out and need replacing. This is his first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, for which he promises to be responsible with his payments and toward the institution. The 2500 soles that he is requesting will permit him to buy the tools and materials required for him to complete the remaining jobs he has yet to complete for his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 50 años, vive con su hijo en la casa que heredó de sus padres y donde también habita junto a sus hermanos. Desde muy joven trabajó en diversas fábricas de costura con el fin de ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar. Pero desde que tuvo su hijo se independizó y gracias a su experiencia pudo implementar un taller textil dentro de su casa, donde también instaló algunas máquinas de costura. María inició su negocio teniendo como clientes a sus vecinos y amistades, pero posteriormente se contactó con algunos fabricantes que le solicitaron sus servicios para el acabado de prendas de alta calidad. Es así que todos los días trabaja en su taller sin un horario fijo, debido a la cantidad de ropa que recibe, sobre todo cuando hay campañas en temporadas específicas, donde aprovecha para producir mayor cantidad con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, este tiempo le ha permitido formar un excelente equipo de trabajo junto a sus compañeras con quienes conforman su banco comunal, donde cada una de ellas trabaja con compromiso y responsabilidad. Los 2000 soles que ahora solicita los invertirá en la compra de materiales textiles indispensables para su producción.
texts.en:
50-year old María lives with her son in the house she inherited from her parents. Her siblings also live there. Ever since she was a young woman, she has worked in various sewing factories so she could help her parents with the household expenses. But after having her son, she started working for herself, and because of that successful venture, she has been able to open a textile workshop, containing several sewing machines, in her own home. María began her business with neighbours and friends as customers, but later she was contacted by various manufacturers who employed her to add the finishing details to high-quality clothing. So now she spends every day in her workshop, working long hours because of the quantity of clothing that she receives. She is extra-busy when there are seasonal orders, and she takes advantage of these periods to increase her income. This is her seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP, who this time have allowed her to form an excellent work team. Together they form a community bank, and each member of the team is committed and responsible. The S/.2000 loan will be used to buy the textiles that are indispensable to the business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy textiles

loans.name: Lidia

texts.en:
Lidia is 61 years old, is divorced, and lives with her son and his family.

Lidia started her own business when she was 50 years old. She sells cosmetics and small home products at the open market. She has a booth that closes so that she does not need to take her inventory back and forth every day any more.

Lidia's goal is to help her son's family financially and improve their living conditions. She would like to borrow 9,000 UAH to increase her inventory. This is her second micro-loan from HOPE.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth tiene 30 años, vive junto a su pareja y sus 2 hijos, quienes son su mayor tesoro. Luego de varios años de arduo trabajo, ella y su esposo lograron terminar de construir su casa propia donde habitan hace 3 años. Gracias a su habilidad en el comercio, Ruth incursionó en la venta de accesorios para damas (pulseras, ganchos para el cabello, aretes, entre otros), instalando su puesto en las puertas de los colegios y otras veces, en la plaza de su localidad. En esta actividad trabaja por más de 8 horas, sin embargo, el contacto con sus clientes le agrada, pues conoce los diversos gustos de las jóvenes, quienes son las más exigentes para solicitar artículos acorde a la moda y temporada. Para comprar su mercadería, Ruth se traslada constantemente al centro de la ciudad, donde adquiere obtiene mejor calidad y precios bajos. Su deseo a futuro es tener un local donde pueda ofrecer sus accesorios y productos de belleza con mayor comodidad, logrando así la estabilidad de su negocio en pro del progreso de su familia. Este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP y lo que más le agrada de su banco comunal es la responsabilidad y compromiso con las que trabajan todas sus compañeras. Con los 500 soles que viene solicitando comprará mayor cantidad de mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
30-year old Ruth lives with her husband and their two children who are her greatest treasure. After several years of hard work, she and her husband managed to complete their own home where they have lived for three years. Because of her business skills, Ruth started selling women’s accessories (bracelets, hair ornaments, ear-rings etc) from a stall close to high schools or in the nearby town plaza. She works eight hours a day doing this; she enjoys contact with her customers, and as well she gets to know what the girls like. They want whatever is in fashion at the time. To buy products, Ruth travels regularly to the city centre where she can find better quality items at good prices. In the future she would like to have a more comfortable place from which to sell the accessories and beauty products. Her business would be more stable, and her family could get ahead. This is Ruth’s seventh loan with Kiva partner MFP. The aspects of the community bank that she likes most are the responsibility and commitment shown by all the women who belong to the bank. With the S/.500 loan, she plans to buy more merchandise for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more merchandise

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es: Vladimir tiene 27 años, es soltero y busca apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, ya que ellos son las personas más importantes para él. Desde muy joven aprendió a desempeñarse en diversas labores, tratando de especializarse en una actividad, es así que encontró en la carpintería un trabajo rentable. Para ello implementó su taller en su casa, donde trabaja con su familia desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche. Sin embargo la demanda se está incrementando y para ello trata de trabajar horas extras con la finalidad de incrementar sus ingresos económicos. Una de sus metas actuales es independizarse de su familia y comprar las maquinarias indispensables para realizar trabajos de alta calidad, es por ello que trabajar arduamente.  Este es su primer préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y tiene la esperanza de que este crédito le permitirá lograr sus anhelos, por ello se compromete a ser responsable con sus pagos. Los 1500 soles que solicita serán invertidos en la compra de herramientas y maquinarias indispensables para su labor.
texts.en:
Vladimir is 27 years old, single, and wants to help his parents with household expenses as they are very important to him. Since he was a young man, he has learned a variety of trades, trying always to find something in which to specialize. That’s how he discovered that carpentry would be a profitable line of work. He started a workshop in his house where he works with his family from nine in the morning to eight at night. However, because demand for his work is increasing, he is trying to work extra hours in order to earn more money. One of his current goals is to start his own business and buy the machinery necessary to make high-quality products. For this reason he works very hard. This is Vladimir’s first loan with Kiva partner Microfinanzas PRISMA, and he hopes that the money will allow him to fulfil his wish. He promises to repay the money in a responsible manner. The S/.1500 sole loan will be used to buy the tools and machinery that are necessary for his work.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy tools for his workshop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO BUY BASIC PRODUCTS FOR MAKING STUFFED TORTILLAS

loans.name: Mirna María

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, la señora Mirna O. se dedica a su actividad de venta de productos plásticos tales como bolsas, platos, vasos, cubiertos, entre otros teniendo su propio establecimiento en el mercado central.

Ella es madre soltera con tres hijos que mantener y para esto busca la manera de salir adelante en su negocio ofreciendo mayores cantidades de productos. Con el crédito que solicita en Ceprodel lo utilizará para la compra de los productos plásticos para ofertarlos en su negocio.

loans.use: Compra de productos plásticos

loans.name: Paula Azucena

texts.es:
La señora Paula E. se dedica arduamente a su actividad de venta de cosméticos donde ofrece los productos de perfumes, shampos, cremas, tintes para cabellos, entre otros.

Actualmente ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de los cosméticos y por esta razón es que espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado para así dar continuidad a su negocio en su establecimiento en el departamento de León específicamente en el mercado central.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula E. is arduously dedicated to her cosmetics business, in which she sells perfume, shampoos, lotions, hair dyes, and other beauty products.

She is currently requesting this loan from Ceprodel so that she can purchase cosmetics, and for this reason she confidently waits for her loan to be granted, so that can keep her business afloat in the department of León, specifically in the central market.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es: Ermelinda L. D. P. D. 26 años, resiD. en el Cantón el limón ubicado en el municipio D. Soyapango, ella vive junto a su esposo y sus tres hijos todos menores D. 7 años. Ermelinda posee un negocio D. cereales y productos D. primera necesidad, tanto ella como su familia dependen D. las ganancias D. este negocio, ya que su esposo trabaja junto a ella ayudándole a atender a los clientes. Ermelinda solicita un préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y poder mejorar sus ventas y D. esta manera los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Ermelinda L. D. P. is a 26-year-old woman who lives in the El Limón canton, located in the Soyapango municipality. She lives with her husband and three children who are all under age 7. Ermelinda owns a business in which she sells grains and basic need items. Both she and her family depend on the profits of this business because her husband helps her attend to the customers. Ermelinda is requesting this loan in order to be able to restock her shop and be able to improve sales, thus improving the family income.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods

loans.name: Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Ángela A. dedica sus esfuerzos al negocio de venta de productos lácteos como queso y cuajada los cuales son ofrecidos por ella misma en el M. central de la ciudad de León.

Es de importancia destacar que ella tiene 10 años de tener el negocio y en este período lo ha logrado desarrollar satisfactoriamente y la razón por el cual acude a Ceprodel es para solicitar un nuevo crédito para la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los lácteos y así continuar mejorando su negocio en el M..
texts.en:
Ms. Ángela A. dedicates her efforts to selling dairy products like cheese and curd at the central market in the city of León.

It is important to note that she has been in business for 10 years, during which time she has managed to adequately develop it. The reason why she is now turning to Ceprodel is to request a loan so that she can purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare the dairy products, thus continuing to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for dairy products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es: Ernestina P. D. A. 44 años resiD. en Santa Tecla junto a sus cuatro hijos mayores D. edad, los cuales se dedican a trabajar. Ernestina posee una venta D. tortillas en su propia casa desD. hace 12 años, así mismo venD. hielo y frijoles. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar maíz y frijoles al por mayor, así mismo comprar varios cilindro D. gas propano. Ernestina desea mejorar las condiciones D. su negocio, ya que a pesar que todos sus hijos trabajan, ella debe esforzarse por  obtener el dinero necesario para todos sus gastos personales, así mismo desea seguir con su negocio el cual le permitió brindarles una vida digna a sus cuatro hijos.
texts.en:
Ernestina P. D. A. is a 44-year-old woman who lives in Santa Tecla with her four grown children who all work. Ernestina has been selling tortillas from home for 12 years. She also sells ice and beans. She is requesting this loan in order to purchase corn and beans wholesale, and she also wishes to purchase tanks of propane. Ernestina would like to improve her business because despite the fact that her children work, she needs to make an effort to earn the money she needs for her personal expenses. She would like to continue running her business, which allowed her to proviD. a decent living for her four children.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn and propane tanks

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
A sus 66 años de edad, la señora  Canderaria M. se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida la cual es elaborada por ella misma haciendo deliciosos platillos variados que agradan mucho a sus clientes. 

Actualmente, ella ha acudido a Ceprodel porque requiere de un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de la materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y así comercializarlos en su establecimiento logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes que le visitan a diario para la compra.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar alimentos

loans.name: María Aminta

texts.es: María Aminta P. D. F. D. 36 años D. edad habita en Santa Tecla ubicada en el departamento D. La Libertad,  ella es una madre soltera la cual trabaja arduamente por brindarles una vida mejor a sus dos pequeños hijos. María elabora platillos típicos, los cuales los venD. en su casa y los comercializa D. manera ambulante por las calles D. Santa Tecla. María es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, la cual cuenta con muy buenas referencias por parte D. sus vecinos, ya que se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora la cual se esfuerza por sus hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo, puesto que desea comprar más materia prima para la elaboración D. los alimentos y D. esta manera invertir más en su negocio.
texts.en:
María Aminta P. D. F. is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Santa Tecla, located in the department of La Libertad. She is a single mother who works arduously in order to proviD. a better life for her two young children. María makes traditional meals, which she sells both from home and as a street vendor in Santa Tecla. María is a very cheerful and diligent woman who has good references from her neighbors because she is known for working hard for her children. She is requesting this loan because she needs to purchase more ingredients to prepare her meals, thus investing more money into her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients to prepare traditional dishes

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Juan Daniel

texts.es: Juan Daniel T. M. de 20 años de edad, reside en San Vicente junto a su compañera de vida y su hija de un año de edad. A pesar de su corta edad Juan cuenta con tres años de poseer su negocio en el cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, golosinas y bebidas, entre otros productos más. Juan es muy reconocido en su lugar de vivienda por ser una persona emprendedora, la cual trabaja a diario por brindarle todo lo mejor a su familia. Es por esto que el solicita un préstamo para poder invertir en su tienda y así mismo pagar otras deudas que ya posee.
texts.en:
Juan Daniel T. M. is a 20-year-old man who lives in San Vicente with his live-in partner and their one-year-old daughter. Despite his young age, Juan has had his own business—in which he sells basic need items, candy, beverages, and other products—for 3 years. Juan is well-known in the neighborhood for being an enterprising person who works daily in order to give his family the best. For this reason, he is seeking a loan so that he can invest in his store, as well as pay other debts that he has incurred.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock his shop and repay a previous loan

loans.name: Judy Lee

texts.en:
Judy Lee P. owns a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. She wants to grow her farm to support her family. She has three children, the eldest being 5 years old. Her dream for her children is that they will seriously attend to their subjects in school and graduate in college.

Judy Lee has been a CEVI client for two years now. The reason why she requested a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI is to help finance their farm like buying fertilizers and chemicals.

Judy Lee said that she likes CEVI policies especially the 2% interest rate every month which is lower and very, very affordable to repay.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and chemicals for her farm

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
En el  mercado central del departamento de León la señora Martha E. vende refrescos a la intemperie con el propósito de llevar el bienestar a su casa de habitación. También vende reposterías en conjunto con los refrescos y es muy visitada por los clientes en su establecimiento.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas para elaborar dichos refrescos y para la compra de las reposterías. Espera en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su actividad con miras a obtener un lugar estable y no a la intemperie.

loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaborar refrescos

loans.name: Reina Beatriz

texts.es: Reina Beatriz Z. D. M. D. 41 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador, vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos. Reina posee 4 años D. trabajar en su propio negocio el cual es una tienda en la cual se comercializan productos perecederos, cabe mencionar que dicho negocio esta ubicado en su lugar D. habitación. Reina solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder mejorar sus ventas, ya que desea aumentar el número D. productos D. su tienda y D. esta manara brindar una mayor gama D. productos, y así poder posicionarse como la mejor tienda del lugar y que todos los vecinos la prefieran.
texts.en:
Reina Beatriz Z. D. M. is a 41-year-old woman who lives in San Martín, located in the department of San Salvador. She lives with her family, which is comprised of her husband and two children. Reina has had her own business for 4 years. She sells perishable goods in her general store, which is located in her house. Reina is seeking this loan in order to improve sales because she wants to increase her goods and offer a greater spectrum of products. Thus, hers can become the best store in the area that all the customers prefer.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more goods

loans.name: Mayela Cayetana

texts.es:
La dama Mayela E. se ha caracterizado por ser una persona trabajadora la cual vende golosinas en el Mercado central de León en su establecimiento contando con dos canastos donde oferta caramelos y galletas a los visitantes en el mercado.

El motivo por el que acudió a Ceprodel fue para solicitar un crédito debido a que estos productos se le van agotando poco a poco y requiere mantener sus estantes llenos de productos para ofrecerlos y así obtener ganancias para continuar manteniendo su hogar.
texts.en:
Ms. Mayela E. is known to be a hard-working person who sells candy at the Central Market of León. She has two basketfuls of candy and cookies that she sells to the market goers.

The reason why she is now turning to Ceprodel is to request a loan because her products are running out little by little, and she needs to keep her shelves full so that she can sell them and make the money she needs to keep supporting her household.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier d'Atikoumé à Lomé où elle s'est spécialisée dans l'activité de tresse qu'elle exerce depuis 1993. Elle est mariée et est mère de 02 enfants. Cette activité lui permet d'apporter sa contribution financière dans la vie du foyer et dans l'éducation scolaire de leurs enfants. Actuellement elle a besoin d'acheter 15 pièces de mèches Curly, 10 pièces de mèches Outrées, 10 pièces de mèches Lisses. C'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de réaménager son atelier de tresse.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Atikoumé district of Lomé where she became specialized in braiding hair as her work, a business she has been operating since 1993.  She is married and the mother of two children.  This business allows her to bring her monetary contribution to home life and for educating their children.  Currently, she needs to buy hair extensions: 15 Curly, 10 Outrées, and 10 Lisses.  To do so, she's requesting a loan from WAGES.  This loan will also enable her to fix up her hair salon. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hair extensions for doing weaves

loans.name: Precila

texts.en:
Precila M. is 62 years old and is happy with her supportive husband and her seven children that she cares for.

Precila is a rice grower and started her farm in 1967. She helps her husband manage a 1-hectare (2.5-acre) farm. Before her first loan in Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI), it was really difficult to sustain her livelihood.

Precila has requested a loan of Php 12,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to finance her farm like buying fertilizer and seed. She hopes everything will result in prosperity and an abundant harvest for her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seed

loans.name: Carmen Cecilia

texts.es:
Carmen Cecilia C. posee su propia pulpería a la que ella atiende desde hace varios años ofreciendo todo tipo de productos tales como productos personales  y productos comestibles vendidos en el departamento de León donde ella vive actualmente.

La señora Carmen ha atravesado la necesidad de invertir en su negocio y por este motivo acudió a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así continuar esforzándose para mejorar el negocio en su establecimiento y continuar sustentando su hogar.

loans.use: Compra de productos

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de maíz y otros productos para surtir negocio

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: bineta N. est parent beneficiaire et evolue dans la vente de draps de lit depuis sept ans.elle sollicite un credit de cent mille(100 000)frs pour diversifier ses articles afin de satisfaire sa clientele.avec son activite elle soutient son ,ari a entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Bineta N. is a recipient parent and has been developing her sales of bedding for seven years. She’s requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to diversify her merchandise in order to satisfy her customers. With her business, she supports her husband in taking care ofr her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Rosa De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Rosa D. los Ángeles R. D. L. D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango junto a su esposo, su hija y una nieta. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa todo tipo D. productos D. primera necesidad, así también se dedica a la venta D. tortillas al mediodía con el fin D. obtener una ganancia extra a la tienda. Rosa es una señora muy querida en el lugar, ya que siempre se ha destacado por ser muy responsable y trabajadora, Rosa solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder surtir su tienda y hacer crecer aún más su negocio, así mismo desea comprar al por mayor el maíz que utiliza para la realización D. tortillas.
texts.en:
Rosa D. los Ángeles R. D. L. is a 57-year-old woman who lives in the Ilopango municipality with her husband, daughter, and granddaughter. She owns a general store in which she sells basic need items, but she also sells tortillas at noon so that she can make a little extra money. Rosa is well-liked in the area because she has always stood out for being very responsible and hard-working. Rosa is requesting this loan in order to restock her shop and expand her business. She would also like to purchase corn wholesale so that she can prepare her tortillas.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase provisions for general store and corn

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina Juárez C. tiene 27 años de edad. Vive en su propia casa con su conyugue su único hijo. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica y ha tenido la oportunidad de trabajar con Fundación León 2000, ya que le han brindado la ayuda suficiente para salir adelante con su negocio. Ella dio inicio a este negocio por cuenta propia los productos que inicio a vender fueron arroz, azúcar, frijoles y golosinas en general. Con el paso del tiempo fue aumentando sus productos. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra pan, refrescos naturales, jugos, gaseosas y golosinas.  El sueño de Rosa es obtener otra fuente de ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rosa Haydee

texts.es: Rosa Haydee O. D. F. D. 56 años D. edad, resiD. en San Martín junto a su esposo y un hijo, ella posee una venta D. productos para la confección D. prendas D. vestir, así mismo cuenta con una venta D. repuestos para maquinas D. coser. Rosa solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder surtir con más productos su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite colaborar junto a su esposo con los gastos del hogar, es por esto que Rosa espera obtener mayores ganancias, al aumentar el número D. productos que comercializa y todo gracias al préstamo que solicita.
texts.en:
Rosa Haydee O. D. F. is a 56-year-old woman who lives in San Martín with her husband and son. She owns a fabric and notions store, in which she also sells spare parts for sewing machines. Rosa is requesting a loan with the hopes of being able to stock her shop with more products because this business allows her to collaborate with her husband to cover the household expenses. For this reason, Rosa hopes to gain greater profits by increasing her inventory, all thanks to this loan that she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Judith

texts.en: Judith A. started raising pigs since 1993. She is 39 years old mother of 4 children. She said that her business is doing well until now. She has a barn at the back of her house and currently raising 5 pigs for fattening. She wanted to buy more piglets to grow her business even more, that is why she requested a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. Receiving this loan is really helpful because this is already Judith A.'s  life, to grow pigs.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Dora Haydee

texts.es:
Dora H., mujer sencilla y de carácter muy humilde, sobresale por ser una clienta en grupo solidario muy destacada, era la coordinadora del grupo y promovedora de la responsabilidad y de la puntualidad.

Actualmente está manejando créditos individuales de montos superiores y sigue siendo una mujer de negocios muy exitosa. Hace 18 años Dora generaba ingresos en su hogar a través de la venta de hielo, helados y la elaboración de sopas los domingos. Hasta que conoció ADIM hace 10 años y le hablaron de la oportunidad de ampliar su negocio. 

Fue entonces cuando decidió iniciar la venta de comida en su hogar.  Actualmente Dora vende todo tipo de comida y bebidas por las noches (Comida típica, refrescos, jugos naturales, helados, hielo, entre otros).

Con la ayuda de su esposo lograron sacar adelante su hogar; y aun que ha tenido que enfrentar el golpe de la pérdida de su esposo, afirma desea terminar de criar a sus hijo menor y poder ver a sus nietos por muchos años. Son estos el  motivo de su fuerza, ya que la pérdida de su esposo le ha dejado un vacio muy grande. “Pero esto solo se pasa enfocándose en el trabajo y los seres amados” dice Dora

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la mejora del negocio y una mínima parte en algunos medicamentos. Anhela con comprar herramientas que le facilites el trabajo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Dora H., a simple and humble woman, stands out in the group as a noteworthy client. She was the group coordinator and promoted responsibility and punctuality. She is currently handling individual loans of larger amounts and continues being a successful business woman. For the last 18 years Dora has been generating income from her home by selling ice, ice cream and soups on Sundays. Ten years ago she found out about ADIM and was made aware of opportunities to enlarge her business. She then decided to start the sale of food from her home. Currently Dora sell all types of food and beverages in the evenings ( Local dishes, refreshments, natural juices, ice creams, ice, and others). With the help of her husband they have been able to get ahead. Even after suffering the terrible loss of her husband, she is set on raising her small son and wants to be able to see her grandchildren for many years to come. This is the reason for her strength, especially after the large void left by the loss of her husband. "This happens only by focusing on my work and my loved ones" says Dora. She plans to invest the proceeds from her loan in her business, with a small portion going towards some medications. She wishes to buy equipment that will make the work of her business easier.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic grains and equipment for her food business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaboración de alimentos.

loans.name: Juan José

texts.es: Juan José B. de 50 años de edad, reside en San Pedro Perulapán en el departamento de Cuscatlán. Vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus tres hijos, los cuales en sus tiempos libres colaboran con el negocio. Juan José posee un comedor y una tienda, él se dedica a tiempo completo a sus negocios, y es por esto que  desea mejorar las ganancias, puesto que es la única fuente de ingresos que el posee para sustentar de todo lo necesario a su familia. Juan solicita un préstamo con el fin de comprar materia prima para la elaboración de la comida que comercializa, y así mismo desea aumentar los productos de su tienda, de manera que tenga muchos más que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan Jose Beltran is 50 years old, lives in San Pedro Perulapán in the departments of Cuscatlán. He lives with his life partner and their three children, who help in the business in their free time. Juan Jose has a dining hall and a store. He works at his businesses full time and for this reason wants to increase his income. This is the only source of income for the support of all the requirements of his family. Juan is requesting a loan for the purpose of buying raw materials for the food that he will sell and also increase the inventory of products in his store, thus having more to offer to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for the production of food and supplies for his store.

location.town: San Pedro Perulapán, departamento de Cuscatlán

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene L. is 38 years old farmer and mother of three children. her eldest child is 17 years old and studying in High School. Her main crop is rice and the harvest that she gets in her farm is intended for their consumption while the rest are sold to her friends.

She requested a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farm and buy seeds as well as the payment for the laborers.

She said, she likes CEVI policies on loans especially the insurance coverage.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort sells palm oil. She is 40 years old and married with 4 children. She has been in the business for long. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She is requesting for the loan amount of N120, 000 to purchase more palm oil to sells. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: María  Elena

texts.es: María  Elena A. D. C. D. 36 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos. Ella tiene una tienda en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, como pan, agua embotellada y así mismo golosinas y refrescos entre otros productos más. La tienda esta ubicada en un lugar muy estratégico, ya que se encuentra cerca D. una escuela y también se encuentra muy cerca D. la playa llamada El Zonte en el puerto D. La Libertad. María Elena solícita un préstamo ya que desea aumentar sus productos y D. esta manera poder ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes y turistas que llegan al lugar. Así D. esta manera podrá obtener mayores ganancias lo cual beneficiará a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena A. D. C. is 36 years old and lives in the department of La Libertad. She lives with her husband and two children. She has a store where she sells basic staple items, such as bread, bottled water and also sodas and refreshments among others. The store is located in a good location, near a school and close to a beach called El Zonte in the port of La Libertad. Maria Elena is requesting a loan to increase her inventory of products and thus be able to offer more variety to her customers and tourist that come to her place. In this way she can produce more income which will be beneficial to her family.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more products for the store.

loans.name: Isaura

texts.es: Isaura F. D. C. D. 58 años D. edad resiD. en La Libertad,  vive junto a sus dos hijos y su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil. Isaura posee una carpintería en la cuál se dedica a elaborar roperos, estantes, mesas, entre otras cosas más. A pesar D. ser un trabajo muy duro para ella, ha logrado crecer en su negocio D. manera que sus vecinos solicitan su trabajo, y así también distribuye sus artículos a diferentes mueblerías incluso en la capital del país. Isaura solicita un préstamo, ya que desea comprar materia prima para su negocio, D. esta manera ella podrá realizar mas rápido su trabajo ya que contará con más recursos para realizarlo.
texts.en:
Isaura is 58 years old, and resides in La Libertad, El Salvador. She lives with her two children and her husband, who works as a mason. Isaura has a carpenter shop in which she makes clothes racks, shelves, and tables, among other things.

Despite the fact that this is very hard work for her, the business has grown to the point where her neighbors are asking for her work, and she is even distributing her articles in different furniture stores, even in the national capital.

Isaura is requesting a loan to buy prime materials for her business. In this manner, she will be able to finish her work more rapidly, since she will have greater resources which which to accomplish it.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY WOOD

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel M. is 23 years old, married, and has one child who is five years old. She lives in Kigali, the capital of Rwanda. For six years she has owned a small shop where she sells different kind of merchandise, as shown in the picture. Her shop is open everyday from 7:00AM to 6:00PM. Before starting the business Rachel was a full-time housewife and could not get enough money to meet the needs of her family.

With the new loan she has requested, Rachel will be able to purchase more merchandise for her shop which will help her to earn more profit and to expand her business. She also hopes that once this business grows, people in her community will be able to buy groceries. With the expansion of her business, she hopes to employ neighbors in the community so that they can send their children to school.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra dejugos enlatados y materia prima para alimentos

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: stock up

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta D. is a pig grower. She has a barn closeby in her house and raises 5 pigs for fattening. She likes her job being a businesswoman. She said, she very much attaracted to pigs that is why it bemae her business.

Availing CEVi loan is truly helpful for her to sustain her livelihood. The loan will go far in buying another piglets and feed.

She hopes that she will be successful always in her endeavor. She likes to partner CEVI because they are giving small interest rate of 2% a month plus insurance ocverage.

loans.use: piglets and feed

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina grinds things like pepper, beans, corn and tomatoes in the market. She is 40 years old and married with four children. She has been in this business since 2002. She hopes for a loan 150,000 nairas to purchase a grinder. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a grinder

loans.name: Daysi Lilian

texts.es: Daysi Lilian F. D. R. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Tamanique, departamento D. La Libertad; vive junto a sus dos hijas, las cuales se dedican a estudiar. Daysi posee una venta D. comida, la cual la comercializa en el mercado Municipal D. alimentos, ubicado en el departamento D. La Libertad. Ella solicita un préstamo para que D. esta manera pueda invertir mas en el negocio, comprando materia prima para la elaboración D. alimentos y así  mismo poder comprar más jugos enlatados para ofrecer a sus clientes. Daysi desea mejorar su negocio, ya que es por medio D. este que ella logra proveer D. todo lo necesario a sus pequeñas hijas.
texts.en:
Daysi Lilian F. D. Rodriguez is 40 years old. She lives in Tamanique, in the state of La Libertad. She lives there with her two daughters who both go to school. Daysi sells meals for a living. She sells it at the county's food market located in the state of La Libertad. She is asking for a loan to be able to invest in her business buying additional supplies to make more meals and purchase more canned juices to offer to her clients. Daysi wishes to improve her business since it is her means to proviD. everything necessary for her two little daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase canned juices and food supplies to make meals

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience   sells medicine. She is 46 years old and married with 5 children. She has been in the business for long. She is requesting for the loan amount of N150, 000 to purchase more medicine to sells. She says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Compra de materia prima para elaboración de especias.

loans.name: Berta Luz

texts.es: Berta Luz R. C. de 40 años de edad, reside en Armenia en el departamento de Sonsonate. Vive junto a sus tres pequeños hijos, los cuales dependen en absoluto de ella. Berta se dedica a la elaboración de especias las cuales se utilizan para darle sabor a los alimentos, así mismo se encarga de venderlos de manera ambulante en diferentes ciudades de Sonsonate. Ella solicita un préstamo para poder comprar más materia prima para la elaboración de las especias y de esta manera tener una mayor cantidad de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Berta desea mucho obtener mayores ganancias, ya que debe suplir todas las necesidades básicas de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Berta Luz R. C. is 40 years old. She lives in Armenia in the state of Sonsonate. She lives there with her three little sons who completely depend on her. Berta produces spices which are used to add flavor to food. She also sells the spices in an ambulant fashion in different cities in Sonsonate. She is asking for a long to be able to buy additional supplies to increase her spice production and offer greater quantities to her clients. Berta very much wishes to increase her profits since she must meet her sons' basics needs.

Translated from Spanish by Linda Zamora, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials to produce food spices

loans.name: Inti Wara Group

texts.es:
El  centro focal Cascada esta ubicado en la ciudad de El Alto, a este pertenece la asociación “Inti Wara”,está formado por once miembros y trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer hace cuatro años aproximadamente.
Además de dedicarse al comercio de ropa, la mayoría de las integrantes han encontrado en los alimentos una actividad lucrativa. Algunas son carniceras, es decir ofrecen variedad de carnes (res, pollo, cerdo, pescado  y menudencias),  otras venden verduras, frutas y comida.   Todas afirman que necesitan capital para la compra de productos en mayor cantidad, con esto aumentaran sus ventas y mejoraran las condiciones económicas en sus hogares.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PRODUCTOS EN MAYOR CANTIDAD

loans.name: Silvia Janneth

texts.es: Silvia Janneth Gonzales B. tiene 45 años. Ella tiene 3 hijos a su cargo y como toda madre responsable está en la obligación de proporcionarle estudios y alimentación. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es ofrecer servicio de decoración. Hace más 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, la ubicación es en su casa de habitación y en algunas ocasiones tiene que realizar la decoración servicio a domicilio. Su marido ayuda a realizar aportes para la familia el labora como docente en un colegio privado y juntos han podido salir adelante. A pesar de lo pocos ingresos que obtienen viven con las comodidades necesarias. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima, como piñatas, pega, lápices de colores, festones, globos y cintas. El sueño que tiene es muy humilde ya que solamente desea seguir adelante con este negocio.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy toys wholesale

loans.name: Fuente De Vida Groups 1 & 2

texts.en:
Miosotis is the coordinator of Banco D. Esperanza’s (Bank of Hope) Fuente D. Vida (Source of Life) group, which is located in the rural outskirts of L. Romana. She lives in a "batey," a community set up for workers who cut sugarcane in the blistering Dominican sun. Despite the remoteness of these communities, Miosotis says she is happy to be able to live with her husband and three children ages 19, 16 and 10 years old in their small home.

Miosotis is excited to take her first loan with Esperanza in order to open a small nail salon to serve the women in her community. With this loan she will purchase a small table, nail machine and acrylic nails. She hopes that this new income will help her to support her family. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: A nail machine, acrylic nails and a table

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou N. est parent bénéficiaire dans la zone de camberene depuis 1993.son activité principale est la vente de petit déjeuner.mais parallèlement elle évolue aussi dans la vente de savon en poudre.elle a une expérience de cinq ans dans son activité.elle sollicite un prêt de cinquante mille(50 000)frs pour accroitre son fond de roulement et ainsi faire face a la forte demande.elle contribue beaucoup a l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Fatou N. has been a client in the Camberene area since 1993. Primarily she sells breakfast, but at the same time she is evolving in the sale of powdered soap. She has five years of experience in her occupation. She is requesting a loan of fifty thousand (50,000) francs to increase her working capital and thus meet the high demand. She contributes much to improving the living conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: small restaurant

loans.name: Matilde Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Matilde es originaria del Barrio Medrano Andino, nubicado en Ticuantepe, Municipio de Managua. Principal zona de comercio en ese municipio.

Matilde se dedica a tres tipos de negocios. Ella compra ropa al por mayor en el mercado principal de Managua y la vende a sus clientes en su municipio; Además compra Cerdos y los destaza y vende la carne de éstos; Y vende comida por la noche en su casa.

Dado la demanda que tiene de productos, sus 2 hijos mayores le ayudan a administrar el negocio, ya sea cundo vienen de trabajar o los fines de semana.
