Este es su quinto ciclo de crédito y está muy satisfecha con su trabajo y pretende invertir su crédito en reforzar los tres negocios. Pero sobre todo el de destace de cerdo que le genera ganancias optimas.
texts.en:
Matilde is from the Medrano Andino neighborhood, which is located in Ticuantepe in the municipality of Managua. It is the main commercial region in this municipality. Matilde has three types of businesses. She buys clothes wholesale in the main market in Managua, and she sells them to her customers in her municipality. She also buys pigs, butchers them, and sells the meat. And, she sells food in the evening in her house. Given the demand for the products, her two older children help her run the business when they come from work or on the week ends. This is her fifth loan cycle. She is very satisfied with her work. She will invest the loan to strengthen her three businesses. Above all, the pork butchering generates optimal earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pigs to butcher and to stock her clothing store

loans.name: Veronica Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Verónica del Rosario D. A. ella tiene 37 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La señora Verónica se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella vende en su casa de habitación y distribuye  de manera ambulante. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 5 años, ella empezó a vender ropa nueva y usada a sus vecinos, sin embargo con el tiempo logro obtener mayor variedad de artículos. Su financiamiento será invertido en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercancías como es la compra de ropa de uniformes escolares y en la compra de cosméticos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una tienda, en la cual pueda vender todos los artículos que ella ofrece con mayor comodidad y facilidad.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel A. Narváez  tiene 48 años de edad, es soltera y tiene 5 hijos, la mayoría de los cuales ya son mayores de edad. La señora Maria  se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida.  La ubicación de su negocio es en su humilde vivienda. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace 10 años, en la búsqueda de fuentes alternativas de ingresos para la manutención de su familia. Ella empezó vendiendo muy poco, ahora posee una clientela bien establecida, además que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y ganarse la vida d una manera muy humilde. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de materias primas para la elaboración de sus comidas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar aceite, frutas y carnes. Su sueño es llegar a tener un restaurante, que brinden mayores ingresos a su familia en general.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Leonel's Group

texts.en:
Leonel is the group coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) Cristo y Nuestro Esfuerzo (Christ and our effort) located in a Batey (small village set up for those who work in the sugarcane industry) outsiD. of La Romana. He lives in the Batey with his wife and three children aged 13, 11 and 8.

As the name of his group suggests he is willing to put in effort and he has been a successful associate of Esperanza for one loan cylcle now. He is seeking this loan to continue increasing the size of his merchandise purchases which allows him to purchase at a lower price. He says that working with Esperanza has already helped him to increase his business and improved the quality of his life. He thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Shoes, wigs and perfumes to sell

loans.name: Kimber Group

texts.es: El grupo Kimber está formado por Marbely de los Ángeles R. E. de 26 años, Tomasa Petronila P. R. de 64 y Teresa Suhey V.
texts.en: The Kimber Group consists of Marbely de los Ángeles R. E. (age 26), Tomasa Petronila P. R. (age 64), and Teresa Suhey V.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Elsa Emerita

texts.es: La señora Elsa Emerita V. Suazo  ella tiene 53 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos ya mayores de edad. Ella tiene la actividad económica de mercadería en genera. Ella dio inicio a este negocio hace  25 años, sin embargo ya tenía 2 años de estar vendiendo de forma ambulante cuando logro establecer  su negocio en el mercado. Ella empezó vendiendo ropa y calzado, y con el tiempo logro vender una mayor cantidad y variedad de vestuario. El financiamiento será invertido en la compra de productos para el colegio de ambos sexos. Su sueño es llegar a tener una pulpería para obtener más ingresos para su familia.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Marthe

texts.fr: F. Marthe est née le 29/07/1966 à Cotonou au quartier Guincomey, un quartier de la zone commerciale de Cotonou; où elle mène actuellement ses activités. Marthe est épouse de BACHIROU Moussedekou, mécanicien auto de formation. Moussedekou continue d’exercer son activité de mécanique auto depuis 25 ans. Marthe est mère d’une fille âgée de 16 ans qui est en classe de seconde. Marthe mène comme activité la vente d’igname frite et de beignets de haricot depuis 20 ans. Cinq ans après cette activité elle décide de diversifier ses activités par la vente de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). En vue de bien satisfaire sa clientèle, Marthe veut renforcer son fonds de roulement. Mais entre temps le mari de Marthe était malade et Marthe a dû abandonner la vente de divers. Vu l’amélioration de la santé de son époux et la forte demande des produits divers, Marthe décide de reprendre ladite activité. Pour y parvenir Marthe sollicite l’aide de ALIDé. Marthe est actuellement à son cinquième prêt avec ALIDé et rembourse bien ses prêts.

loans.use: Achat de 65 litres d’huile d’arachide, des condiments, de haricot, de tubercule d'igname et de charbon de bois; des divers.

loans.name: Pedro Pablo

texts.es: El señor Pedro Pablo O. Lanuza se dedica a la compra y venta leña. El vive con su esposa y sus 4 hijos gracias a su arduo esfuerzo a podido sacar adelante a su familia para darles un hogar y una educación, ya que el por falta de recursos solo finalizo sus estudios de primaria. El está solicitando este financiamiento para invertirlo en su negocio, ya que todos los días tiene que levantarse temprano para ofrecer sus productos. Trabaja de manera rustica con un carretón jalado por un caballo. Su mayor sueño es proporcionarle a su familia lo necesario para que no les falte nada.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Rolando Antonio

texts.es: Rolando Antonio L. S. tiene 43 años vive con su esposa y su único hijo que depende de él. El es dueño de un comedor, en donde ofrece deliciosos platillos, a pesar de los diferentes desafíos que Rolando enfrento fue la poca afluencia de clientes que obtuvo al inicio, esto no fue fácil, ya que tenía mantener a su familia. Pero con el tiempo logro salir adelante. Inicialmente empezó a ofrecer pocos platillos, pero con la ayuda de su esposa han logrado aumentar la cantidad de platillos. El financiamiento es para la capital de trabajo para la compra de granos básicos carnes y otros productos que son necesarios para el comedor. Su deseo es acondicionar su local con las condiciones adecuadas.
texts.en:
Rolando Antonio L. S. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and their only child. He owns a diner where he offers delicious dishes. Of all the various challenges he faced, the most difficult obstacle for Rolando to overcome was the low influx of customers at the start of his business. It wasn’t easy, but with the support of his family, he eventually succeeded.

He offered a few dishes at first, but his wife helped him with expanding their menu. The loan he is requesting will be used as working capital to buy basic grains, meats, and other products used for preparing his dishes. Rolando hopes to renovate his establishment in order to provide more suitable conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Julio Jose

texts.es: Julio Jose Cáliz M.  tiene 34 años es padre de familia y tiene 3 hijas. La actividad económica del señor Julio es la elaboración de artesanías en una propiedad que está ubicada en la carretera nueva a León. Realiza la actividad de manera manual, Hace 10 años tiene este negocio. Inicio porque tenía que proporcionarle a su familia una estabilidad económica y a sus hijos una educación. El es un hombre muy responsable y disfruta mucho su trabajo por que las artesanías son su medio de vida.  El empezó trabajando como ayudante y luego aprendió a fabricar piezas de barro. El financiamiento es para compra de materia prima y elaborar artículos de barro para su venta. Sus deseos son tener dinero suficiente para trabajar con capital propio.
texts.en:
Julio Jose Cáliz M. is a 34 year old family man with 3 daughters. He makes handcrafted items from his property, located along the new highway to León. Julio started his business 10 years ago because he wanted to provide financial stability for his family and an education for his children. He is a very responsible man who enjoys his work as an artisan.

He began working as an apprentice and then learned to make pottery. His loan will be used to buy raw materials for making clay pots. Julio hopes to have enough money to use as operating capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: La Fe 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Yaquelin is an experienced businesswoman who has been plying her traD. selling clothing (including pants, shirts and hair accessories) and beauty products for five years. Yaquelin is the group coordinator of the Banco D. Esperanza (Bank of Hope) L. Fe (The Faith) based in a small community of sugar cane cutters (called a batey) outsiD. L. Romana. Here she lives with her five children, ages 10, 8, 5, 3, and nine months. She is raising her children alone as a single mother. In this community, there is no access to electricity, running water or trash pickup.

Yaquelin's plan with this loan is to increase her stock by purchasing more merchandise at a better price. This is her third loan with Esperanza, and both she and the organization are confident in her abilities as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy pants, creams, polo shirts, T-shirts and ponytail holders

loans.name: Ngene

texts.en:
Ngene is a thirty five year old mother of two school going children who lives and operates her grocery and food kiosk business in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. She has requested her sixth loan of Ksh.60,000 to add stock of cabbage, kales, tomatoes, onions and other products. She has successfully paid five loans and managed to buy cows, buy land and build a home for her family out of her business profits. She hopes that one day she will build a house from where to operate her business. She describes herself as jovial, social and diligent.



Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa started her business selling clothes and accessories three years ago with her first micro-loan. She was a housewife before starting her business and has taken on the task of raising four children while running her own business. 

Her business has done very well and she has even been able to send her eldest child to college. Now she would like another loan in order to grow her business more by increasing her inventory. With this loan she will buy pants, blouses and bracelets. All her children are doing very well in school and she would like to be able to send all of them to college. 

You can help Rosa and her children achieve their dreams by funding this loan!

loans.use: Pants, blouses and bracelets

loans.name: Danelia Del Socorro

texts.es: La Señora Danelia C. A., es cliente de la institución Fundación León 2000 es una mujer muy trabajadora su actividad económica es ofrecer los servicios de costura. Hace más de 20 años que se dedica a este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Aquí habita con sus hijos y su esposo. Aquí es donde fabrica mochilas, pantalones cortos de niño, bolsos y uniformes para estudiantes, por lo que ha logrado mantener el bienestar a su familia, su cónyuge es el encargado de comercializar los productos en el mercado oriental de la ciudad capital. Juntos han logrado salir adelante. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de hilos, tijeras, tela, centímetro y otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle a su familia lo mejor.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Jeanelyn

texts.en:
Jeanelyn L. started tilling a 1.5 hectare farm since she got married in 2002. Her husband is a farmer. They have two chidren and their eldest child is 6 years old. She started to worry about their growing finances epecially because her eldest started to go to school.

She is asking a loan from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay the farm laborers and to buy rice seeds.She also aspires to get started to a new business which is pigs.

Receiving a loan is really helpful for him to improve her income to support her children and husband.

loans.use: farm laborers, rice seeds

loans.name: Wenifredo

texts.en:
Wenifredo B., a 43-year-old father of three children, is a rice grower. He works from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day to maintain a hectare rice field and a poultry farm as well. He started the business four years ago and this is very helpful to his family because they earn almost all of their income from rice and eggs.

He would like to ask for a loan of Php 12,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. He will use the loan for farm financing, buying chickens and buying feed for his poultry.

He said he likes the services in CEVI and hopes that he can seek more loans in the future.

loans.use: Farm financing and poultry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rannie

texts.en:
"My farm (is) doing great. Because of it I am able to provide the needs for my family," says Rannie, a 34-year-old farmer. He only has one child who is 15 months old now. He started farming in 2008 and now he needs additional capital to run his farm and make it more productive.

He is asking for a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures to support his farm. Receiving a loan will truly help him buy farming needs like rice seeds and fertilizers.

His dream for his child is to be a good person when he grows up. He said he likes CEVI services because of the insurance coverage and small interest rate they provide.

loans.use: Farm financing

loans.name: Ninfa

texts.en:
Ninfa B. is 54 years old and has thirteen children. She runs a sari-sari (general) store and a rice farm. She has been a Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI) client for quite a long time now.

Ninfa has requested a loan of Php 10,000 from CEVI to support her sari-sari store. Basically, she will use the loan to buy additional merchandise to attract more customers in order to increase her sales.

She said she likes CEVI because, aside from charging less interest on their loans, they also bring education to all their clients.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca B. is 50 years old farmer from Banga, South Cotabato Mindanao. She has 8 children and is married to Victor B. since 1976. Her family owns a 1-hectare farm. The rice farm is their main source of livelihood. All their grains are put to their stock room for family consumption. Sometimes, they also sell rice grains especially if they have bountiful harvest.

She is asking a loan of php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to finance her farm and buy fertilizers and pesticides.

CEVI help her sustain her business because without the loan, she might have sold her farm.

loans.use: farm financing

loans.name: Bernie

texts.en:
Bernie C. is a 39-year-old rice farmer who lives in Banga, South Cotabato, Mindanao. He is the father of three children, the eldest being 10 years old. In addition to growing rice, he also owns a small basic store in their location. This has helped his family to supplement their income.

Bernie has requested a loan of Php 10,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). He will use the loan to pay for a farm laborer and fertilizers.

It was November 2008 that he first joined CEVI. He said he likes the program and the staff and that is why he has stayed with CEVI for quite a long time now.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay for a farm laborer

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella is 35 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions very close to her house. She hopes for the loan amount of 120,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She sells foodstuffs in the market. She hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She say thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria F., 58, is a mother of five and owns a small rice field in Banga, South Cotabato, Mindanao. She is a rice farmer and she has been helping her husband till the farm since the date of their marriage.

She requested a loan of 10,000 Philippine pesos from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to pay for laborers, who help prepare the farm before planting, and for fertilizers to improve the quality of the rice.

She joined CEVI in 2008. She still likes the services and wants to take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: Laborers and fertilizer

loans.name: Johanna Patricia

texts.es: Johana patricia G. tiene 36 años de edad. Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y ambos estudian. Johana es una excelente cliente en Fundación León 2000 ya que se preocupa por mantener su buen record crediticio. Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 17 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que sus inicios fueron muy difíciles ya que tenia pequeños a sus hijos y no tenía suficiente dinero para pagarle a una persona para que se los cuidara, por lo que tenía que salir a vender sus productos por la tarde a ofrecer sus productos, algunos veces viajaba con ellos, pero logro salir adelante a pesar de estas dificultades. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de ropa, cremas, colonias, tratamientos, perfumes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es obtener un lugar propio para ofrecer sus productos.
texts.en:
Johana Patricia G. is 36. She is a single mother with two children who go to school. Johana is an excellent client of Fundación León 2000. She is conscientious about keeping her good credit record. She buys and sells general merchandise. She has been in this business for over 17 years. In the beginning it was very difficult. Her children were small, and she did not have enough money to pay someone to take care of them. She had to leave to sell her products in the afternoons. Some times she took her children with her. She was able to get ahead in spite of these difficulties. The loan she is asking for is for working capital to buy clothes, creams, colognes, treatments, and perfumes, among other things. Her wish is to get a place of her own to sell her products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen is 33 years old and married with a child. She sells jewelry in front of her house. She has been in this business for the past 3 years. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more jewelry to sell; she says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more jewelry to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 48years old and married with 5 children. She sells sarongs in front of her house. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for long. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more sarongs to sell, she says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more Jewries to sell.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
el sr. Ricardo Z. O. comenzo alquilando en la colonia villanueva, despues le salio una oferta para comprar un terreno y lo compro, luego pudo empezar a construir su casa de habitacion, tiene 8 años de estar construyendola por partes, poco a poco ha logrado avanzar en este proyecto, que el lo llama el proyecto de su vida, construir su casa.
ahorita el esta solicitando un credito para poder ponerle ladrillos de piso a toda la casa (sala y cuarto principal) ya tiene la base de cemento y solo le faltan poner los ladrillos.
Nos comento que se siente muy feliz ya que siempre todos los años logra hacerle algo a su casa.
el tiene 3 hijos y dice que quiere hacerles una casa digna para ellos.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo Z. O. began renting a home in the neighborhood of Villanueva. Afterwards, he submitted an offer to buy a piece of land and successfully completed the purchase. He has spent the last 8 years constructing his house in stages. The progress has been slow in this undertaking, which he calls the project of his life.

Right now, he is requesting a loan so that he can install a brick floor for his house (in the living room and master bedroom). The cement base has already been completed, so only the bricks are missing. He tells us that he is satisfied because he manages to complete a piece every year.

He has three children and says that he wants to give them a decent home.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand, and bricks for installing a floor

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana Catarina

texts.es: La Señora  Juana Catarina L. L. cuenta con 57  años de edad, es Viuda vive conjuntamente con sus dos hijos y actualmente  se dedica a la Artesanía como costurera de delantales típicos lleva 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad cuenta con dos maquinas industriales, y se encuentra en el lugar conocido como paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa Municipio y Departamento de Totonicapán  actualmente la demanda de sus clientes a crecido y por las condiciones en la que ella vive no son suficientes para ampliar su capital de trabajo y así cubrir la demanda por tal razón se acerco a la Instalación de la ASOCIACION ASDIR para adquirir un pequeño préstamo y así crear otra fuente de ingresos. Generando mejores oportunidades en su trabajo como también sus ingresos a si poder cubrir sus gastos mensuales.

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Obasogie Dolly

texts.en: D. is 38years old and married with 4 children. She sells eggs. She hopes for the loan amount of N80, 000 to purchase more eggs to sell, she says thanks to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more Eggs to sell.

loans.name: Mateo Miguel

texts.es: Don Mateo Miguel T. T., cuanta con 30 años de edad es casado actualmente vive con sus tres hijos y con su esposa se dedica a la artesanía en la elaboración de cortes típicos, y se cuenta en el lugar conosido como caserío Chuipachaj de la Aldea Chipuac del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán cuenta con un pequeño taller elaborando esta producción no cuenta con operarios por la situación de sus ingresos que no son suficientes y la demanda actual a la que presenta a crecido por tal motivo se acerco a las oficinas de la Asociacion ASDIR  para adquirir un pequeño préstamo así poder comprar materia prima, para la ampliación de capital generando empleo y mas productos de su pequeño taller ayudando a generar mejor sus ingresos a si darles una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Don Mateo Miguel T. T. is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He is dedicated to the art of making traditional fabrics from his small workshop in the village of Chuipachaj de la Aldea Chipuac, which is in the town and district of Totonicapán. He does not generate enough revenue to hire any workers. However, his current demand is growing, so he visited the offices of Asociación ASDIR in order to secure a small loan to purchase raw materials. The increase in capital will result in more employment and more products from his small workshop, as well as generate additional income to give his family a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort is 38 years old and married with 2 children. She sells drinks. She has been in business since 1998. She hopes for the loan amount of 60,000 Nigerian naira to purchase more drinks to sell.  She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Martina

texts.en: Martina is 42 years old and married with three children. She sells snacks and drinks. She requesting the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks and snacks to sell. She say thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more snacks and drinks to sell

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es: Don Vicente P. A., cuanta con 51  años de edad es casado actualmente vive con sus cuatro  hijos y con su esposa se dedica al comercio de utensilios para el hogar vende por unidad como ambulante y se encuentra en el lugar conocido como Paraje Patzite de la zona uno  del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán cuenta con su pequeña micro empresa lleva 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad por su situación económica que tiene no son suficientes para la compra otros tipos de productos para cubrir el pedido de sus clientes por la misma razón se acerco a  las instalaciones de la asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo mejorando a si sus ingresos mensuales como también generando mejor su capital de trabajo

loans.use: Comercio (Compra de mercaderia)

loans.name: Fabiola Del Rosario

texts.es: Fabiola del Rosario Hernández Bárcenas tiene 25 años. Ella es una joven con un gran espíritu emprendedor. Su actividad económica es la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo y cada día lucha por salir adelante. Fabiola tuvo ciertos problemas porque no tenía  la experiencia necesaria para ofrecerle a sus clientes sus productos pero esto lo ha conseguido con el tiempo y así obtuvo mucho más clientes. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de calzado, ropa, perfumes entre otras cosas. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana sus hijos tengan un donde vivir.
texts.en:
Fabiola del Rosario Hernández Bárcenas is a 25 year old woman who possesses a tremendous entrepreneurial spirit. For more than 6 years, she has been dedicated to her modest business selling general merchandise. She has 2 dependent children and struggles each day to get ahead.

Fabiola had faced difficulties because she didn’t have the necessary experience to offer her customers the products they wanted, but she was able to overcome that with time and attract many more customers. Her loan will be used as operating capital to buy shoes, clothing, perfumes, and other items. She hopes to make improvements to her home so that her children will have a decent place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Doña Teresa V. Chalán, cuanta con 23 años de edad es casado actualmente vive con un   hijos y con su esposa se dedica a Artesanía confeccionando playeras y sudaderos lleva 8 años dedicándose a esta actividad en la actualidad la demanda de su cliente fuera de la ciudad donde ella reside a crecido en números de demanda a s favor por los ingresos que obtiene no son suficientes para cubrir otros pedidos por tal motivo se acerco a las oficinas de la  Asociación Asdir para adquirir inmediatamente un préstamo por las necedades que ella tiene así poder comprar dos máquinas industriales para poder facilitar su trabajo al mismo tiempo crear otras fuentes de empleos en su comunidad como también mejorar sus ingresos mensuales, como también el crecimiento de su pequeño taller.

loans.use: Artesania (compra de maquinas industriales)

loans.name: Erminia Isabel

texts.es: Erminia Isabel A. tiene 44 años. Tiene 3 hijos y ninguno depende de ella, la actividad económica es la compra y venta de cerdo. Hace más de 5 años que se dedica a este negocio. Erminia inicia este negocio por la necesidad de obtener una fuente de ingresos, ella se dedica a ofrecer sus servicios de domestica, pero al no obtener el suficiente ingreso para su familia, decide dedicarse a esta actividad económica. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de cerdo y materia prima. Su deseo es que sus hijos finalicen sus estudios y logren ser buenos profesionales para el día de mañana.
texts.en:
Erminia Isabel A. is 44 years old and has 3 adult children. For more than 5 years, she has been in the business of buying and selling pork. Erminia previously worked as a domestic employee, but her income was not enough to support her family so she decided to start this business so that she could earn more money.

The loan she is requesting will be used as operating capital to buy pork and supplies. She hopes that her children finish their studies so that they can become successful professional in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jesús Santa

texts.es: Doña Jesús Santa Chalán Y., cuanta con 50  años de edad es Viuda actualmente vive con sus dos  hijos ella  se dedica a Arsenia  elaboración de sudaderos lleva 11 años dedicándose a esta actividad productiva conjuntamente con sus hijos en su pequeño taller que se encuentra en el lugar conocido como Paraje ChiC. del cantón Paqui, municipio y departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala actualmente la demanda de su cliente a crecido por lo que ella necesita comprar más materia prima  así poder cubrir la demanda por lo que se acerco alas oficinas de la Asociación ASDIR para adquirir un préstamo para la compra de más productos, cumpliendo asi con su trabajo para el sostenimiento de su familia.

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Joel Joselito

texts.es: El Joven  Joel Joselito T. T., cuanta con 21  años de edad es Soltero actualmente vive con sus padres y hermanos se dedica a la artesanía en la confección de Playeras y pantalones, lleva trabajando tres años en esta actividad cuenta con su propio taller la demanda de sus clientes fuera de la ciudad esta creciendo constante mente por lo que necesita comprar, materia prima para poder cumplir con la demanda conjuntamente con sus hermanos creando otras fuentes de trabajo por lo que se acerco alas instalaciones de las oficinas de la Asociación Asdir para adquiriendo un préstamo mejorando sus ingresos como también el crecimiento de pequeño taller cubriendo así sus gastos mensuales teniendo un mejor ingreso.
texts.en:
Joel Joselito T. T. is 21 years old, single, and currently lives with his parents and siblings. For three years, he has been operating his own workshop where he makes shirts and trousers. The demand from his customers outside of the city is constantly increasing, so he needs to buy more materials in order to complete the additional requests. At the same time, the increased demand has created employment for his siblings.

Joel has approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan so that he can expand his small workshop. He hopes to cover his monthly expenses while generating better revenues.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials

loans.name: Lucia Teodora

texts.es: La Señora Lucia T. tiene 41 años de edad, es Casada y con oficios  Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 Telares, habita junto  a sus Hijos, ella y sus Hijas se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 10 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío I Palemop, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lucia T. is 41 years old, married and a weaver. "Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres" has a workshop with 3 looms. She lives with her children, she and her daughters are all weavers and they have two employees. They have been making "Cortes" for 10 years at their home located in the village I Palemop of the Aldea V. of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Presently orders from her customers are growing but her economical conditions are not sufficient to increase her capital so therefore she approached "Asociación ASDIR" to request a loan to buy material and thus increase her sales as well as make her family get ahead and provide better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for craft making

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es: Yamileth del Socorro Martínez M. tiene 31 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Da inicio a esta humilde actividad por su familia ya que anteriormente quien se hacía cargo era su Mama y actualmente lo administra Yamileth que ha demostrado ser una mujer muy responsable con su familia. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de materia prima. El sueño de ella es tener su casa propia porque actualmente vive con su Mama.
texts.en:
Yamileth del Socorro Martínez M. is 31 years old. For a living she has been making and selling tortillas for 6 years. She began this humble activity for her family as her Mother previously was in charge and presently Yamileth administers the business and has proven to be a very responsible woman with her family. The loan requested is for work capital to buy supplies. It is her dream to have her own house as she is living with her Mother at the moment.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital

loans.name: Luis Alonzo

texts.es:
el sr. Luis Alonzo B. se dedica al servicio de transportar personas, el tiene un taxi, un nissan sentra año 1984, dicho carro le ha dado muchas ganancias, pero ahora necesita pintarlo por completo ya que las autoridades de servicios de transportes le exigen que tienen que andar con los carros bien pintados y tapizados para darles mejor servicios a sus clientes. 
en estos momentos Luis no tiene dinero para pintar el taxi y es por tal razon que esta solicitando el credito para poderlo pintar si no lo pueden castigar y queda sin prestar servicios la unidad.
Tambien piensa tapizarlo todo el carro.
texts.en:
Mr. Luis Alonzo B. transports people for a living, he owns a taxi, a Nissan Sentra 1984. This car has given him good earnings, but now he needs to paint it to meet a requirement from the transportation service authorities, demanding that cars be well painted and upholstered to offer better service to the customers.

Presently Luis does not have money to paint the taxi and therefore he is requesting the loan to be able to paint it, if not they may penalize him and he will not be able to offer service with the unit. He also wants to upholster the entire car.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material to paint a taxi.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ana Florinda

texts.es: Doña Ana P. tiene 42 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedor,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su esposo  e hija, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar  Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío  Chaquiral, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Martha Ramona

texts.es: La señora Martha M. tiene la edad de 42 años, reside en el barrio Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, casada, su negocio es la venta de ropa y comida ambulante en las diferentes rutas de la capital, también se mantiene en el mercado Israel Levites. Este negocio lo inicio con fondos propios para sastifacer las necesidades de su hogar, luego para incrementar  opto a préstamo en Afodenic para incrementar su inventario, es su octavo ciclo el cual invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para terminar de anexar un cuarto que tiene y poder estar en  condiciones mejores. Sus planes es poder tener un local fijo donde vender ya que día a día se arriesga a un accidente oh que le roben, también es cansado. Da las gracias a la institución por logros de hacer las mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Martha M., 42, lives in the Memorial Sandino neighborhood in the capital of Managua. She is married. She sells food and clothes as a street vendor on the different routes of the capital. She also sells at the Israel Levites market. She started this business with her own funds in order to support the household necessities. Then, to increase her inventory, she opted for a loan from Afodenic. This is her eighth loan cycle. She will buy construction materials to finish adding a room that she has and to be able to put it in better condition. Her plan is to have a fixed location where she can sell because, day to day, she risks an accident or being robbed. She is also tired. She is grateful to the institution for being able to make improvements on her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to finish building a room

loans.name: Josefa María

texts.es: Dona Josefa A.  tiene 40 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta  de Ropa  Típicas para Mujeres” cuenta con un Pequeño Negocio, habita junto  a su esposo  e hijos, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio  lleva 12 años en la venta de ropa Típica en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chaquiral, de la Aldea V. del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Comercio (Capital de trabajo)

loans.name: Carolina Silveria

texts.es: La señora Carolina G. tiene 25 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposo, ella y su esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 7 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chotacaj, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carolina G. is 25 years old, married and a weaver. "Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres" has a workshop with 2 looms. She lives with her husband and both are weavers and they have two employees. They have been making "Cortes" for 7 years at their home located in the Village Chotacaj, of the Aldea Vásquez of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Presently orders from her customers have increased but the economical conditions are not sufficient so they can increase their capital and therefore she approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan in order to buy material and thus increase sales. She also wants to make her family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for crafts making.

loans.name: Juana Jesús

texts.es: Doña Juana G. tiene 32 años de edad, es Casada de oficios Tejedora,  “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 3 Telares, habita junto  a su Esposo , él y su Esposo se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 7 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Caserío Chotacaj, de la Aldea Vásquez del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana G. is 32 years old, married and a weaver. "Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para Mujeres" has a workshop with 3 looms. She lives with her husband and both are weavers and they have two employees. They have been making "Cortes" for 7 years at their home located in the Village Chotacaj, of the Aldea Vásquez of the department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Presently orders from her customers have increased but the economical conditions are not sufficient so she can increase her capital and therefore she approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan in order to buy material and thus increase sales. She also wants to make her family get ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for crafts making.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Reyna Isabel L. tiene 45 años. Su actividad económica es la venta y elaboración de tortillas. Tiene 4 hijos y ninguno depende de ella. Reyna se levanta temprano todos los días, por lo que tiene la venta inicia desde temprano y tiene clientes de lugares muy largos, pero lo más importante es que aquí obtienen tortillas de calidad. Los créditos que ha recibido de fundación le han ayudado para salir adelante, ya que por medio de ellos ha logrado obtener ciertas mejoras en su vivienda. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, cal, leña. El sueño de Reyna es seguir mejorando su vivienda.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Juan Julián

texts.es: Don Juan G. tiene 43 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Sastre,  “Confección de Pants” cuenta con un taller de 3 Maquinas, habita junto  a su Esposa, él y su Esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 14  años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapá del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan G. is 43 years old and married. He is a tailor. He has a shop, “Confección de Pants”, with three machines. He lives with his wife. They both devote themselves to the same work. They have two employees to help with this work. He has been making typical skirts in his house, which is in the Paraje Xepatriz of the Cantón Nimapá in the Totonicapán department in Guatemala, for 14 years. The current customer demand has grown. But, his economic condition is not sufficient to increase his capital. That is why he went to the ASDIR Association to ask for a loan. He will buy raw material to be able to increase his sales. He is also hoping to be able to get ahead for his family so that they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy raw material

loans.name: Fatima Del Rosario

texts.es: La señora Fátima del Rosario de edad de 41años, reside  en Memorial Sandino en la capital de Managua, junto a su familia, su esposo trabaja en enderezado y pintura,  con dos hijos que estudian,  su negocio es la venta de frutas y verduras que desde hace doce años administra  con capital propio comenzó, para compartir los gastos con su esposo y poder cubrir sus necesidades diaria para su familia. Este crédito es su doce avo en Afodenic y con este préstamo lograra comprar materiales de construcción para terminar de construir su vivienda toda de concreto ya que tiene parte forrada con zin y así  poder estar en mejores condiciones y seguridad. Da las gracias a la institución por los beneficios logrado.
texts.en:
Fátima del Rosario is aged 41 and lives with her family in the Memorial Sandino district of Managua. Her husband works as a panel beater and painter and her two children study. Using her own funds she set up her fruit and vegetable business twelve years ago with the aim of helping her husband to cover their costs and meet the everyday needs of the family. This is her twelfth Afodenic loan and will be used to purchase construction materials to finish building her home completely in concrete, as a part is covered with corrugated metal, making it more habitable and secure. She is grateful to the institution for the progress she has achieved.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Clapham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials to finish building her home completely in concrete.

loans.name: Domingo Benjamín

texts.es: Don Domingo P. tiene 34 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Albañil,  “Maestro de Obras” cuenta,  cuentan con dos empleados para la misma, lleva 8 años, su residencia se encuentra en el Paraje Chiyax, del  Cantón Pasajoc del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materiales para construcción de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.

loans.use: Servicios (Maestro de obras)

loans.name: Jorge Adrian

texts.es: Don Jorge T. tiene 54 años de edad, es casado de oficios Comerciante,  “Venta de Alimentos”, habita junto  a su esposa, el y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 3 años de vender Alimentos   su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje  Choatzam Cantón Juchanep, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida

loans.use: Servicos (Venta de alimentos)

loans.name: Haraldo Filiberto

texts.es: El señor Haraldo C. tiene 38 años de edad, es Casado de oficios Artesano,  “Confección de Pants”, habita junto  a su esposa, el y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar en dicha Confección    su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapá, del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida

loans.use: Artesania (Compra de materia prima)

loans.name: Zonia Ninza

texts.es:
Zonia es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Zonia es soltera, tiene 47 años y 3 hijos, Zonia vende salchipollos de manera ambulatoria en el mercado Magdalena, actividad que realiza todos los días por las noches con el apoyo de sus hijas. Además Zonia tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su casa.
Zonia necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de platos, harina y cremas.
Los sueños de Zonia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un local propio.

loans.use: Para la compra de platos, harina y cremas.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Rosaura es casada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosaura vende cosméticos por catalogo, sus ventas son en mayor parte al crédito, además Rosaura trabaja en la empresa Esika como directora de zona.
Rosaura necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cosméticos.
Los sueños de Rosaura son que sus hijas sean profesionales y tener una tienda de cosméticos.

loans.use: Para la compra de cosméticos.

loans.name: Carlos Luis

texts.es: El señor Carlos C. tiene 56 años D. edad, es Casado D. oficios Artesano,  “Elaboración D. Cortes Típicos”, habita junto  a su esposa, el y su esposa se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años D. elaborar cortes  su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam uno del Cantón Nimapá, del departamento D. Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda D. su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención D. comprar materia prima y D. esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a su familia, y que tengan mejores condiciones D. vida
texts.en:
Señor Carlos C. is 56 years of age, married and lives with his wife in their home in Paraje Xeatzam in the Cantón of Nimapá, Department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. He and his wife work at making Cortes Típicos, traditional Guatemalan clothing, and they also have two employees for the same. They have been doing this for 18 years. At present, their customers' demand is growing but current economic conditions have not allowed them to build up any capital. That's why they have approached Asociación ASDIR to request a loan for the purpose of buying raw materials so that they will be able to increase their sales. They are also hoping they and their family will be able to get ahead and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials.

loans.name: Yeni

texts.es:
Yeny es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Yeny es conviviente, tiene 28 años y 2 hijos, Yeny vende discos y dvd, tiene 3 puntos de ventas en locales alquilados, para lo cual cuenta con personal, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Yeny necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la apertura de un nuevo punto de venta.
Los sueños de Yeny son ampliar sus negocios y tener una tienda grande de venta de celulares.

loans.use: para la apertura de un nuevo punto de venta.

loans.name: Julia Nancy

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No seas Flojo en quechua.
Julia es soltera, tiene 45 años y 2 hijos, Julia vende cosméticos por catálogos que ofrece a amigos y familiares, también vende calzados a pedido, además Julia administra la lavandería de su mama.
Julia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de detergentes.
Los sueños de Julia son tener una sucursal de la lavandería y surtir con mas productos sus negocios.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the Amaquella Communal Bank, "amaquella" meaning "don't be lazy" in Quechua. Julia is 45 years old, single with 2 children. She sells cosmetics through catalogs to friends and family members. She also sells footwear by request. In addition to this she also manages her mother's laundromat. Julia needs a loan of 1200 soles which will be used to purchase detergents. Julia's dreams are to open an additional location of the laundromat and to offer a better variety of products at her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica McBride, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase detergent

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Francisca es casada, tiene 36 años y 4 hijos, Francisca tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas y carne, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños de Francisca son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca is a member of the El Sol Community Bank. Francisca, 36, is married and has four children. She has a store in her house where she sells general groceries like vegetables, fruit, and meat. She does this with help from her husband. Francisca needs a loan for 1,050 PEN to buy rice and sugar. Francisca’s dreams are to improve her business and to provide her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice and sugar

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Francisca es conviviente, tiene 48 años y 3 hijos, Francisca se dedica a la elaboración de panes típicos, que elabora en un horno artesanal de leña, sus ventas los realiza en el mercado Santa Clara.
Francisca necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina y leña.
Los sueños de Francisca son mejorar su horno con maquinas modernas.

loans.use: Para la compra de harina y leña.

loans.name: Irma Zintia

texts.es:
Zintia es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Zintia es soltera, tiene 19 años y 1 hija, Zintia se dedica a la elaboración de queques, pasteles, actividad que realiza en el horno de su mama, sus productos los comercializa en las tiendas, colegios al por mayor.
Zintia necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina.
Los sueños de Zintia son tener una panadería grande.
texts.en:
Zintia is a member of the communal bank, "El Sol." She is single, is 19, and has one daughter. She makes cakes, which she does with her mother's oven, and sells them to stores and to schools wholesale. Zintia needs a loan of 1050 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of flour. Zintia's dream is to have a large bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour

loans.name: Alipio

texts.es:
Alipio es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Alipio es conviviente, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Alipio tiene un carro con el cual realiza transporte publico en la ciudad de Ayacucho, además Alipio se dedica a la agricultura de papa.
Alipio necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de neumáticos.
Los sueños de Alipio son construir su casa.

loans.use: Para la compra de neumáticos.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Elsa es soltera, tiene 32 años y 1 hijo, Elsa tiene un salón de belleza en un local alquilado, además vende golosinas y gaseosas, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Elsa necesita un préstamo de 1050 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de cremas, champú.
Los sueños de Elsa son tener una tienda grande en el centro de la ciudad y casa propia.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank, "El Sol." She is single, is 32, and has one son. She has a beauty salon in a rented location where she also sells candy and soft drinks. She does this every day. She needs a loan of 1050 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of creams and shampoo. Elsa's dreams are to have a large store in the middle of the city and to own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase creams and shampoo

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal El Sol.
Lidia es divorciada, tiene 59 años y 9 hijos, Lidia viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. abarrotes y panes y D. las ferias compra cereales que luego venD. en el mercado D. abastos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.
Lidia necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y cereales.
Los sueños D. Lidia son mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the communal bank, "El Sol." She is divorced, is 59, and has 9 children. She travels to different markets in the region where she sells groceries and bread. At the markets, she buys cereals, which she later sells at the food market in the city of Ayacucho. Lidia needs a loan of 1050 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of rice, sugar, and cereal. Lidia's dreams are to improve her business and to proviD. her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and cereals

loans.name: Juana Pilar

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Juana es casada, tiene 50 años y 6 hijos, Juana viaja a las diferentes ferias D. la región en donD. venD. verduras, frutas y D. las ferias compra cereales, carne, quesos, productos que venD. en los mercados. Además Juana se dedica a la crianza D. animales.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. cereales y cerdo.
Los sueños D. Juana son que sus hijos sean profesionales y tener un puesto en el mercado.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of the communal bank, "Arco Iris." She is married, is 50, and has 6 children. She travels to the different markets in the region where she sells vegetables and fruits. At the markets, she buys cereals, meat, and cheese, which she sells at the markets. Juana also raises animals. She needs a loan of 2000 PEN, which she will invest in the purchase of cereals and pork. Her dreams are to see her children become professionals and to have a stand in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cereals and pork.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Máxima es casada, tiene 42 años y 2 hijos, Máxima vende comida en un puesto del mercado Playa Grau, actividad que viene realizando hace dos meses anteriormente vendía quesos.
Máxima necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la mejora de su puesto.
Los sueños de Máxima son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
Máxima is a member of the communal bank, "Arco Iris." She is married, is 42, and has 2 children. She sells food at a stand in the Playa Grau market. She has done this for 2 months. Previously, she sold cheeses. Máxima needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will invest in making improvements to her stand. Her dreams are to see her children finish their education.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her stand

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Antonia es casada, tiene 50 años y 5 hijos, Antonia tiene un puesto en el mercado Playa Grau en donde vende cereales, además viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región de donde compra carne, queso y cereales.
Antonia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de chuño (papa deshidratada).
Los sueños de Antonia son que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Para la compra de chuño (papa deshidratada).

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Leonarda es casada, tiene 37 años y 3 hijos, Leonarda viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos, carne, productos que vende en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Leonarda necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales y queso.
Los sueños de Leonarda son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar mas sus negocios.

loans.use: Para la compra de cereales y queso.

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
Elena es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Elena es casada, tiene 38 años y 6 hijos, Elena viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende ropa variada y de las ferias compra cereales, queso, productos que vende en el mercado Nery.
Elena necesita un préstamo de 600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y blusas.
Los sueños de Elena son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Elena is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Elena, 36, is married and has six children. Elena travels to different regional fairs to sell various clothes. At the fairs she buys grains, cheese, and other products to sell in the Nery market. She needs a loan for 600 PEN to buy pants and blouses. Elena’s dreams are for her children to become professionals and to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pants and blouses

loans.name: Aurea

texts.es:
Aurea es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Aurea es casada, tiene 45 años y 7 hijos, Aurea viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde vende verduras y panes, y de las ferias compra cereales, animales, sus ventas los realiza en los mercados de la ciudad de Ayacucho de manera ambulatoria.
Aurea necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales.
El sueño de Aurea es mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Aurea is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Aurea, 45, is married and has seven children. Aurea travels to different regional fairs to sell vegetables and bread. At the fairs she buys grains and animals. She then sells them in an ambulatory manner at the markets in the city of Ayacucho. Aurea needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy grains. Aurea’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy grains

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es socia del Banco Comunal Arco Iris.
Haydee es conviviente, tiene 35 años y 2 hijos, Haydee viaja a la selva ayacuchana en donde vende ropa usada, producto que adquiere en la ciudad de Lima, además Haydee junto a su esposo tienen 1 carro con el cual realiza taxi en la ciudad.
Haydee necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa usada.
Los sueños de Haydee son construir su casa y tener una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Haydee is a member of the Arco Iris Community Bank. Haydee is 35, in a common law marriage, and has two children. Haydee travels to the Ayacuchana jungle where she sells used clothes. She gets her products in the city of Lima. Also, Haydee and her husband have a car, which is used as a taxi in the city. Haydee needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy used clothes. Haydee’s dreams are to build her house and to have a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothes

loans.name: Vanessa Lizeth

texts.es:
Vanessa tiene 22 años de edad y vive junto a su esposo y su hijo de dos años de edad en el caserío La Zaranda, distrito de Pítipo, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Su esposo trabaja eventualmente como obrero y, debido a que los ingresos que percibe no son suficientes para mantener a toda la familia ella empezó hace un año a vender comida en el colegio de la zona.

Todos los días se levanta temprano para preparar los platos que vende: algunos son dulces típicos, otros platos de comida y al momento del receso se sitúa en una área del patio de la escuela y vende sus productos a los escolares los que esperan con mucha expectativa su llegada.

Ella desea terminar de construir su casa y a la vez comprarse una computadora para realizar trabajos de investigación y ayudar a los estudiantes, sabe que debe seguir trabajando en su negocio para lograr sus metas, por lo que ha solicitado por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de golosinas para vender a los estudiantes de la zona.

Vanessa es muy conocida en su comunidad y es considerada una mujer responsable, por este motivo las autoridades del colegio de la zona le han confiado la venta de alimentos para los alumnos de dicha institución.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 22 years old and lives with her husband and two year old son in the village of La Zaranda in the district of Pitipo, which is located 45 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Her husband currently works as a laborer, but his income is not enough to support their entire family. She started selling food a year ago at the local high school.

Every day, Vanessa wakes up early to prepare the food she sells – traditional sweets and other snack items. During recess, she sets up her vending post in the schoolyard patio. Students wait with great expectation for her to arrive and start selling her products.

She wants to finish the construction of her house. One time, she bought a computer for the students to help them with their research. Vanessa knows that she has to keep working at her business in order to achieve her goals. For this reason, she is requesting her first loan from our Institution in the amount of 700 soles so that she can buy candy to sell to the students.

Vanessa is well known in the community and is considered to be a responsible woman. Therefore, the local school authorities have entrusted her with selling food to the students.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy for resale

loans.name: Felipe

texts.es:
Felipe tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos en la ciudad de Monsefú, ubicada a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace dos años vende flores en el vivero municipal de la ciudad de Chiclayo, las flores se las envían desde la ciudad de Caraz (ubicada en la región Ancash) y todos los dias se levanta temprano para ofrecer el producto a sus clientes.

El tuvo que empezar este negocio debido a que sus hijos ya terminaban sus estudios secundarios en el colegio y deseaba brindarles algún tipo de educación superior, ahora el desea ampliar su negocio para seguir educando a sus hijos motivo por el cual esta solicitando por primera vez a nuestra Institución un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar mas flores que ofrecer a sus clientes.

Felipe es una persona bastante conocida y estimada por sus compañeros de trabajo, ellos lo consideran una persona trabajadora y que da todo de si para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Felipe is 44 years old, married, and lives with his wife and three children in the city of Monsefú, which is located 20 minutes outside of the city of Chiclayo.

For the past two years, he has been selling flowers at the municipal nursery in the city of Chiclayo. The flowers are shipped in from the city of Caraz (located in the Ancash region) and every day he wakes up early so that he can offer these products to his customers.

Felipe started his business because his children are about to finish high school and he wants to provide them the opportunity to pursue some type of higher education. He wants to expand his business so that his children can continue their studies. For this reason, he is requesting his first loan from our Institution in the amount of 1000 soles so that he can buy more flowers to sell to his customers.

Felipe is well-known and respected among his colleagues. They consider him to be a hardworking person who wants to do everything in order for his family to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flowers for resale

loans.name: Erlyn

texts.en:
Erlyn L. is from the village of Dalapang, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 23 years old and married with one child. To make a living, Erlyn is starting a business offering motorcycle transport services in the local community.

Erlyn has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services that will improve her living situation and ability to engage in these business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to repair her motorcycle, and she will reinvest her earnings into the business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle.

She is planning to purchase new fishing net in their newly acquired boat. She is very optimistic that they can generate more income if they can have another net. 

She has been a good member in the cooperative since her affiliation. She is now utilizing her second loan cycle and proves to be of great help in their livelihood activities.

texts.en:

With a little display stand for her fish in their barangay (district), Julieta was able to earn a monthly average income of not less than PHP 5,000. She started this fish vending business twenty years ago and her business is still running.

Julieta joined Paglaum MPC (PMPC) in August 2008. Now, she is applying for PHP 14,000 as her 4th loan to add to her capital in her existing business. She is thankful to PMPC because of the savings and education programs it provides to its members. Her only wish is more blessings to her family and business success.

Felomina S. is from the village of Barra,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Felomina is married. To make a living, Felomina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling seafood products such as fish and shrimp in the local community. Felomina has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Felomina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Felomina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,500.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Felomina is requesting a new loan of 3500 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Felomina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Rosabella S.

texts.en: Rosabella C. is from the village of Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Rosabella owns and operates a business providing hairdressing and beauty services to local community members. She has been engaged in her business for over thirty-two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Rosabella joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase materials needed to provide service. Rosabella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be her 2nd from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Batchuluun

texts.en:
Batchuluun M. is a 43-year-old, hard-working man who lives with his wife and three daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His oldest daughter entered an agricultural university this year and his younger two attend a secondary school.

Batchuluun started producing horse saddles in 1995 and his wife sold them at the Narantuul market, the largest out-door market in the city. His wife has recently been employed by the Water Authority as a cleaner, and Batchuluun also works for the Water Authority as a guard for which he is paid 250,000 tugrugs (~173 USD). The famliy lives in their own ger (nomadic housing tent) in the Water Authority's storage yard. Because Batchuluun’s wife is busy with her job, his sister helps him out by selling the goods.

Batchuluun’s business has been popular, and he's got regular customers. In the future, he hopes to use the continued success of his business to build a house for his family and move them out of the ger that they currently live in. He requests a 940,000 tugrugs loan to purchase more supplies for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies for his business

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en: Virginia P. is from the village of Upper Centro, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old and is widowed. Virginia owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling gasoline in the local community. Virginia is just starting this business. In 2005, Virginia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Batsukh

texts.en:
Batsukh D. is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His wife is a co-owner of his business.

Batsukh started his business early in 1994. In 2001, he started to sell pants in the Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in the city. He sells all types of men’s and women’s cotton pants. When he started his business, he was selling pants he had sewn himself. As it took a long time and a lot of hard work to sew each pair of pants, he started to sell ready made ones. Today, his working capital exceeds 2,200,000 tugrugs (~1,520 USD) and his sales are approximately 2,000,000 tugrugs (~1,380 USD) per month with a profit of 300,000-400,000 tugrugs (~210-270 USD).

Batsukh is an experienced and hardworking businessman. His wife helps him sell the pants at the market and they go to purchase pants in shifts. Batsukh said: ”We will keep running our business until our two children get into professions.” He is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrugs loan to buy more goods.

loans.use: To purchase more pairs of pants to sell

loans.name: Enkhsaikhan

texts.en:
Enkhsaikhan S. is a 28-year-old businesswoman who operates a clothing business at the local indoor market.

Although, she graduated from college, Enkhsaikhan did not have a chance to work in her chosen field because she needed to care for her baby. Her husband is the head of the marketing department for a local commercial bank. Because the young family doesn't have enough savings to buy their own home, they currently live with Enkhsaikhan's parents in their apartment.

In 2004 Enkhsaikhan started her business and, thanks to her energetic and enthusiastic nature, her business has grown steadily, thus enabling her to have a second stall which her mother helps her run. Her working capital now exceeds five million tugrugs (~3,450 USD) and her monthly net profit is between 210-270 USD. Once a month she buys goods from Beijing, China. She is very good at keeping daily records, and says "My plan is to have my own home."

Enkhsaikhan requests a 1,300,000 tugrugs loan to purchase more supplies so as to expand her business.
