loans.use: To purchase more supplies for her business

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma P. is from the village of Gango Rizal, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 48 years old and married with 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Thelma operates a sari-sari (general) store where she sells both food and daily use products in the local community. Thelma has had the store for over 20 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month.

Thelma recently joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting her first loan from GDMPC, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell in her shop.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products for her shop.

loans.name: Tserenbaljir

texts.en: Tserenbaljir O. is a 30 year old businessman who lives with his wife and two children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Four years ago, he got married and built own house inside his yard. His wife used to work at sausage making workshop and now is at home, taking care of their 2 month old daughter. Tserenbaljir graduated from an art university and used to work as a music teacher at secondary school #20. Since 2006, he has run a taxi-driving business. As  result  of his hard work, he owns two cars. He drives one of the cars himself, while he leases the second for 150,000 (approx. $ 104 USD) tugrugs per month.  He earns between 15,000-20,000 ( approx. $10-14 USD) tugrugs per day from his taxi business. Tserenbaljir plays the morin khuur,  a mongolian traditional two- stringed musical instrument, and  he plans to work as a musician some day in the future. Tserenbaljir  is requesting a 1,500,000 tugrug (approx. $690 USD) loan to purchase tires for his vehicles and to renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase tires for his vehicles and to renovate his house.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en: Yolanda D., 47, hails from the breezy town of Silang, Cavite, a couple of miles south of Manila. She has four children, all school-aged. Yolanda buys fruits and vegetables from farmers and traders then retails them to market buyers. She has been running this business for the last five years and earns a net income of P5,000 per month. She uses her profits to pay for her children’s education and to provide for her family’s basic daily needs. Yolanda joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2005 and has since been receiving blessings both spiritually and economically. She is now on her ninth loan with the cooperative. Yolanda needs a loan of P14,000 as additional capital for her fruits and vegetables business. She hopes to acquire her own vehicle soon to help her transport the fruits and vegetables. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital to expand her business

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
This is Jocelyn U., 44 years old. She lives in Parang, Marikina City, in the eastern side of Metro Manila. She is a single parent to her three children.

Jocelyn has a stall in the Concepcion Public Market. She has been selling fresh dressed chickens since 1983 and earns a monthly net income of P28,000.

Jocelyn needs a loan of P12,000 so she can buy more fresh chicken meat from the poultry farms. She has learned the value of saving money since joining the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative. She saves a lot for the education of her children.


About CCT
The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To buy more fresh chicken meat from the poultry farms

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia S. is 43 years old. She is married and is blessed with three children: Nicola, 20 years old and in her 4th year at college; Karen May, 14 years old, 3rd year high school; and John Klyde,10 years old, elementary school.

Amelia manages a cell phone loading station. She would like to have additional capital for her business to be able to sustain her family’s daily needs. Amelia would be thankful if her loan request of PHP 5000 is approved so she can generate more capital and earn more profit.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios C. is from the village of Tungawa, Tambulig, Zamboanga del Sur. She is a 51-year-old widow and mother of three adult children. To make a living, Remedios operates a general store selling soft drinks and daily use products.   She has been in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

Remedios recently joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Remedios is requesting her first GDMPC loan, for 5000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for her store.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen R. D. M. resiD. en ciudad Arce del departamento D. La Libertad, María vive con su esposo quien es empleado; y su hijo D. 21 años que curso hasta el bachillerato y por motivos económicos ha tenido que aplazar su deseo D. ingresar a una universidad. María tiene dieciocho años D. dedicarse a la venta D. productos por catalogo, las que realiza D. manera ambulante en otras colonias y vecinos D. la zona, María también posee un pequeño inventario D. productos; los cuales ella los compra en oferta y luego los pueD. vender a precio regular desD. su casa, el crédito que solicita María es para aumentar el inventario que posee en su casa.

loans.use: Surtir su inventario

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es: Francisco E. reside en San Juan Opico, en el departamento de La Libertad. Francisco tiene 46 años de edad se encuentra casado con Doña Lilian de E. quien se dedica  cuidar de sus hijos Juan de 14 años y Jorge de 11 años de edad, ambos niños se encuentran estudiando básica en la escuela. Francisco vela económicamente de su familia por medio de su taller, donde elaboran todo tipo de calzado, cuenta con un inventario económico de $325 US, el cual pretende aumentar por medio de este crédito que le permitirá comprar mas cuero, hormas para zapatos y pega , de esta manera su producción al igual que sus ventas lograran crecer.
texts.en:
Francisco E. lives in San Juan Opico, which is located in the district of La Libertad. He is 46 years old and married to Doña Lilian de E., who takes care of their sons Juan (age 14) and Jorge (age 11). Both children are enrolled in school.

Francisco supports his family financially by manufacturing all types of footwear out of his workshop. His current inventory is valued at $325 USD. He hopes to increase his inventory with this loan by purchasing more leather, shoetrees, and adhesives. These materials will help increase his production and result in larger sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making shoes

loans.name: Crispina

texts.en:
Crispina C. is from the village of Macabayao,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 59 years old. Crispina is widowed and has 10 adult-aged children. To make a living, Crispina owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling various food products in the local community. Crispina has been engaged in her business for over 1 years and earns approximately 1,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Crispina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crispina is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Crispina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products for sale

loans.name: María Veralis

texts.es: María Veralis F. M. con 53  años de edad vive en el departamento de La Libertad junto a su esposo y su hijo de 20 años de edad, estudiante de bachillerato. María se dedica a su negocio, el cual es un molino para granos, con diez años de experiencia estando al servicio de de los lugareños en Sonsonate, el crédito que solicita en esta ocasión María es para destino de su  negocio ya que desea darle mantenimiento  a los molinos, de esa manera María y su negocio siempre tendrá el excelente servicio que la caracteriza.

loans.use: Matenimiento a su molino

loans.name: Cristine

texts.en: Cristine is a dealer of personal products such as lotion, powder, dish washing liquid and other cosmetic products. She wants to earn money so that she could be able to sustain her daily needs on her own.  She is thankful because at her young age she was able to sustain her needs through the income that she generates from her business. According to her, she needs to purchase all the orders of her customers so that she could dispose it immediately but her capital is not enough.  In line with this, she is now asking to avail a loan of PHP5, 000.00 as additional capital. Cristine is hoping that her loan request will be approved to be able to attain her goals in life.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Lydiya

texts.en:
Lydiya Z. is 55 years old. She has a husband and lives in a small house in Belaya Tserkov town.

Lydiya sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. She has been in this business for 10 years. She chose this particular business because food is always in demand and thus she will always have clients.

Lydiya would like to borrow 10,000 UAH to purchase seasonal vegetables -- tomatoes, cucumbers, eggplants, etc. This is the time when most people buy this produce and make storages for the winter.

She hopes to make additional income and help her daughter with the wedding expenses, since her daughter is getting married this fall.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventories.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou D. P. is 39 years old and she is married to Pedro, her business partner. Marilou raises hogs and ducks in the village of Nagbukel, San Isidro, Santiago, Isabela. They are grateful because they have been blessed with three children: Jhumar, 21 years old; Jonalyn, 18 years old (both high school graduates), and Jennifer, 13 years old, a 2nd year high school student. 

Marilou works hard in order to make her business more productive and to be able to gain more profit. Thus, she is asking for financial assistance from ASKI amounting to PHP 5000 to purchase additional supply of feeds for her livestock.

loans.use: Additional Capital.

loans.name: Juana Luz

texts.es: Juana Luz G. G. reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Juana tiene 24 años de edad, vive con su esposo que trabaja como empleado y aporta a la familia $200.00 US mensuales, y su pequeño hijo Miguel de tan solo dos años de edad. Juana posee una tienda en su casa, la cual tiene  solamente dos años de existir , siendo esta la razón por la cual la tienda se encuentra con poco inventario y es por eso que ahora Juana solicita un crédito, para surtir su tienda con granos básicos y boquitas que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Sandra Elizabeth

texts.es: Sandra Elizabeth C. de 28 años reside en el municipio de Armenia departamento de Sonsonate. Sandra vive con su esposo quien es empleado de una tienda de zapatos, y su pequeño hijo Sergio de 3 años de edad. Sandra monto una tienda hace un año, tras las necesidades económicas Sandra tuvo la idea que poniendo un negocio en su casa era la única manera para no descuidar a su hijo y su vez ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares. De esta manera hoy Sandra  posee su pequeña tienda la cual pretende ampliar por medio del crédito que usted dará, de esta manera ella podrá comprar mayor cantidad de productos que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra Elizabeth C. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Armenia, located in the district of Sonsonate. She lives with her husband, who is employed at a shoe store. Their young son Sergio is 3 years old. One year ago, Sandra started her business from her home out of economic necessity. Her store was the only way for her to continue caring for her son and still help her husband with the family expenses.

Today, Sandra hopes to expand her small business with the help of this loan. She will be able to buy a larger quantity of products, which will help increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her store's inventory

loans.name: Marta Lilian

texts.es: Marta Lilian G. R. de 40 años de edad reside en el departamento de La Libertad. Marta es una mujer soltera y emprendedora en su negocio, ella posee una panadería donde fabrica variedades pan dulce y pan francés, la panadería de Marta se encuentra ubicada en una casa que Marta alquila y a su vez vive en ella. Marta siempre sueña con expandir su negocio haciendo que su pan llegue a muchos más lugares, este sueño solo se puede ir haciéndolo realidad con la ayuda en este crédito, el cual le permitirá a Marta comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima.
texts.en:
Marta Lilian G. R. is 40 years old, single, and lives in the district of La Libertad. She is an entrepreneur who owns a bakery where she makes a variety of sweet breads and French breads. Marta lives in a rented house, where she also runs her bakery. She dreams of expanding her business so that her bread can be distributed to many more places. That dream can become a reality with the help of this loan, which she will use to buy more ingredients in bulk.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.en:
Ludmila K. is married with two children. She sells women's clothing at the central market.

Ludmila has been in this business for 10 years. Her net income is 2000 UAH per month. She started her business when her family was in need and she made her business a success. It gives her family not only a stable income but also confidence and hope for the future.

Ludmila would like to borrow 4,900 UAH to purchase new inventories for the coming fall season. She would spend the income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase new inventories.

loans.name: Vuy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuy B., age 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sarin Soth, age 29, live in a small village along National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 2007 and have a newborn child.
 
Vuy has been a fisherman since he was married. He fishes from the lake nearby his village and his wife sells the fish at Prek Phnao market. He doesn’t have all the supplies to efficiently operate the fishing business, so he is requesting his first loan of $700 to purchase a boat engine and fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase a boat engine and fishing nets for his fishing business.

loans.name: Cristita

texts.en:
Cristita L. is from the village of Cebulin. She is 59 years old. Cristita is widowed and has 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Cristita owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members. Cristita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Cristita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Cristita is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Cristita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Aleja

texts.en:
Aleja F. of Sitio Gaboc, Barangay Odiong, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental is 49 years old and married with 9 children ranging in age from 9 to 25.  She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in August of 1998, after a friend invited her, and with the first PHP 3,000 loan she borrowed she was able to revive her barely surviving "sari-sari" or general store. Profits from her loans allowed her to buy appliances and furniture, and to make house repairs.

Subsequent loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon allowed her to invest in ducks and she saved the profits until she was able to buy a carabao which she rented out. Today she has several bulls, one cow, and several heads of pigs, and the "sari-sari" or general store is also performing well.  Now Aleja wants to borrow PHP 19,500 to buy more cattle to expand her herd.  Aleja is doing all this so she can provide her children with a good education and secure their future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more cattle.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Mrs. Rin O., 44, and her husband, Mr. Sokhorn Sor, 42, were married in 1991 and have two daughters. Besides her daughter she also has two nieces living with her. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Rin and her husband have been selling Khmer noodles since 2001. They buy it from the villagers who produce Khmer noodles for resale in Prek Phnao market. The couple doesn’t have their own transportation, so Rin is requesting her first loan for $800 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria G. is 50 years old and she is married to Wilson. They are blessed with four children: Gloran John, 23 years, a graduate of a two year course; Glowil John, 21 years old, a graduate of a Hotel and Restaurant Management course; Gerald John, 15 years old, 3rd year high school student, and Glenn John, 10 years old, grade IV.

Gloria owns a tricycle unit where her husband serves as the driver. Aside from that she also sells frozen foods, fish, and meat. She would like to improve her business because she wants to provide for all the needs of her family.

Both Gloria and Wilson are doing all their best so that they can send their two younger children to school. With the additional support of PHP18000 from Kiva lenders, they will be able to maintenance their motorcycle and her vending business.

loans.use: Additional Capital.

loans.name: Pricela

texts.en:
Pricela O. is from the village of Eastern Looc. She is 47 years old. Pricela is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Pricela sells specialty food products in the local community. Pricela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Pricela joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pricela successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase raw ingredients.

Pricela is requesting her 6th loan from PMPC, for 8000 PHP, which she will use to purchase additional inventory and generate working capital. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Victoire Fifamè

texts.fr: H. Victoire Fifamè est née le 21/07/1975 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin au quartier minontchou. Victoire Fifamè a comme profession la coiffure, une formation qu'elle a faite après avoir abandonné l’école. Mais Victoire Fifamè réside actuellement au quartier Gbèdjèwin, un quartier de la zone industrielle de Cotonou depuis qu’elle s’est mariée. Victoire Fifamè s'est Mariée à AKODOGBO Dimonthé, un mécanicien-auto. Ce couple a 4 enfants tous scolarisés, âgés respectivement de 12 ans, 7 ans, 5 ans, et 3 ans. Après sa formation en coiffure, Victoire Fifamè a commencé petitement par vendre des produits de coiffure et de toilette en les distribuant sur commande à ses clients. Victoire Fifamè s’approvisionne sur le marché international de Cotonou et celui de Lomé, Capitale de Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Après son mariage, il y a 8 ans, Victoire Fifamè a ouvert son salon de coiffure avec l’aide de son mari. Victoire Fifamè a continué de vendre des produits de coiffure et de toilette, mais dans son salon de coiffure. Victoire Fifamè a ajouté à tout ceci la vente de chaussures, de savons liquides et de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.).  Victoire Fifamè a commencé par prendre de crédits à ALIDé depuis 2006 ; aujourd’hui, Victoire Fifamè est à son cinquième crédit avec ALIDé. Victoire Fifamè sollicite ce crédit pour diversifier ses activités à la vente des produits lubrifiants.

loans.use: Achats de produits de coiffure et de toilette, de divers, de matières premières pour la fabrication de savons liquides et des produits lubrifiants.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie S., 42 years old, is married to Mario S.. She is a vegetable vendor and at the same time helps her husband in managing their tricycle transport business.

They are happily living in their village with their seven children: Jomar, 23 years old, high school graduate; Marvin, 21 years old, high school undergraduate; Mary Jane, 18 years old, 2nd year college; Jayson, 13 years old, 1st year high school; John Mark, 12 years old, grade VI; Jessa Mae, 7 years old, grade II, and Jonard, 2 years old.

Julie and her husband are helping one another for them to continuously support the education of their children.

She would like to borrow a loan of PHP15000 that she can use for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Del Mangal Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres Emprendedoras del Mangal” se formó gracias al deseo de mejoramiento y superación del nivel de vida de sus integrantes ya que son personas de muy escasos recursos. 

Cada una de las integrantes posee su propia microempresa que lo realizan con mucho éxito. El detalle de los mismos es el siguiente: 
1	Isabel  T. 	Venta de bebidas
2	Zonia A.	Venta de comestibles                                                                                                                                    
3	Ramona B. 	Venta de bijouterie
4	Noelia Y.	Venta de bebidas
5	Zofia L.	Venta de artículos varios
6	Estefana P.	Venta de comestibles
7	Hilaria B.	Venta de frutas
8	Marciana V.	Ventas varias
9	Ana A.	Venta de bebidas
10	Maria T.	Venta de bebidas
11	Mariana G.	Venta de verduras
12	Leticia Y.	Venta de frutas y verduras
13	Jacinta D.	Venta de grasa vacuna y porcina
14	Cristina P. 	Venta de ropa usada
15	Adriana Y.	Venta de verduras
16	Ignacia B.	Venta de ropas
17	Victoriana R.	Venta de frutas y verduras
18	Claudia V.	Venta de comestibles
19	Erita C.	Venta de verduras 
20	Natalia A.	Venta de comestibles

El crédito lo utilizaran para diversas opciones de compra como ser: compra de insumos para la elaboración de comestibles como por ejemplo: harina, huevos, aceite, carne, condimentos, además de comestibles para la venta como leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras, compra venta de melón, sandia , banana, naranja y frutas diversas. Compra de ropas,  calzados, etc. Todas estas mercaderías serán adquiridas con el fin de aumentar las ventas y generar mayores ingresos para lograr  mejorar su forma de vida. 
 Planean invertir en la formación académica de sus hijos ya que anhelan un porvenir mejor para ellos tanto académica  como laboralmente.

loans.use: compra de insumos para la elaboración de comestibles como por ejemplo: harina, huevos, aceite, carne, condimentos ,además de comestibles para la venta como leche azúcar, yerba, harina, sal panificados y verduras, compra venta de melón, sandia , banana, naranja y frutas diversas.

loans.name: Lovely

texts.en:
Lovely B. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 32 years old. Lovely is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Lovely owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Lovely has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Lovely joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 17,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Lovely is requesting a new loan of 20000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Lovely from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Cette dame a décidé en 2008 de vendre du fufu (tubercule d’igname pilée) accompagnée des sauces de mouton et de bœuf. Elle a pris cette décision, parce que son mari a eu sa retraite et il était difficile de subvenir aux besoins de leurs 03 enfants. Son mini restaurant est très fréquenté par les travailleurs du quartier Wéssomé de Lomé. Pour avoir de la viande à conserver pour la restauration, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 2 moutons et 20 kilos de la viande bœuf.
texts.en:
Yawa A. is married and the mother of three children. When her husband retired, they found it hard to provide for them. She decided therefore in 2008 to open a mini-restaurant in which she sells fufu (pounded yam tuber) served with mutton and beef sauce. She has many guests among the working people in the Wéssomé neighborhood in Lomé. Yawa applies to WAGES for a loan to stock up with meat. She will buy 2 sheep and 20 kilograms of beef.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 2 sheep and 20 kilograms of beef

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
She believes that for poor people like her, the most precious legacy she can leave her children is the education that she strives hard to provide them in their formative years.  This is the purpose that drives Alfreda S. of Sitio Cambagting, Barangay Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negrow Occidental.  At 49 years old, Alfreda is married with 4 growing children ages 8, 10, 12 and 18.

Now that her oldest child has started college, she is working doubly hard to earn more money in order to cover the household expenses as well as send her kids to school. In addition to her pig fattening business she is also always on the lookout for other opportunities to supplement her income.  She is optimistic that if she exerts all of her efforts toward her goal, she will be able to achieve her dream to have all of her children finish college and have a better life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more pigs.

loans.name: Komivi

texts.fr: Cet homme est marié et a 02 enfants à sa charge. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, il a décidé en 2007 d’exercer le commerce très rentable du charbon de bois. Beaucoup de gens viennent acheter du charbon chez lui en gros et en détail. Ses charbons sont faits avec des bois de bonne qualité, ce qui fait qu’il a beaucoup de clients. Il sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 25 sacs de charbon de bois. Ce prêt lui permettra aussi de couvrir ses frais de transport vers Kpalimé où il s’approvisionne.

loans.use: Achat des sacs de charbon de bois

loans.name: Mujeres Por La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Mujeres por la Esperanza” tiene 3 años de formación y trabajo con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 4 señoras que emprenderán actividades. .
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina  aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta de ropas, venta de remedios etc. .
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles un mejor horizonte que el que a ellas les toco vivir. .

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como: comestibles: carnes, azúcar, leche, panificados, arroz, maíz, frutas, vegetales diversos, etc. Además remedios naturales, telas, hilos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc.

loans.name: Akoua

texts.fr: Akoua T. est une femme âgée de 59 ans mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle vit  à Adéta une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Elle voulait  profiter de la baisse des prix de mais pour faire un stock. Ainsi lorsqu’il aura une augmentation de prix de mais, elle pourra se servir de son stockage pour faire la préparation de la pate. Ainsi elle pourra alors augmenter très rapidement son bénéfice. Avec ses bénéfices, elle voulait construire son propre bar-restaurant et s’occuper de l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Akoua T. is a 59-year-old woman who is married and the mother of four children.  She lives in Adéta, a town located about 150 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo.  She'd like to take advantage of the drop in corn prices in order to stock up.  So when there's an increase in corn prices, she'll then be able to make use of her stock for making cornmeal mash.  In this way, she can increase her profits very quickly.  With these profits, she would like to build her own bar-restaurant and to take care of her children's education.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up on corn

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.en:
Apolinaria L. is from the village of Katipa. She is 58 years old. Apolinaria is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Apolinaria sells snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Apolinaria has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2005, Apolinaria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Apolinaria successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC that she used to purchase raw ingredients. She is requesting her 9th loan from PMPC for 10000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional inventory and generate working capital.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. Note
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Loreto

texts.en:
Loreto M. is 41 years old and works as a tricycle driver in San Andres Bonifacio, Diffun Quirino. Aside from his transport business, he is also a fruit dealer in the same village, to provide additional income. He buys his fruits every Tuesday, Thursday, and Saturday.

Loreto would like to buy additional fruits so that he can generate bigger income. In this regard, he would like to borrow a loan of PHP 11000 that he can use as additional capital for his vending business and motorcycle maintenance.

Loreto is thankful because he is blessed with a supportive family. He is very optimistic that Kiva lenders will grant his request.

loans.use: Additional Capital.

loans.name: Adjouavi

texts.fr: H. Adjouavi est née vers les années 1952 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Adjouavi est mariée à EGBETOHOKPO Mathias, un commerçant. Adjouavi et Mathias ont 5 enfants, tous scolarisés. Cette famille réside à Gbèdjromédé un quartier populaire de la ville Cotonou. Adjouavi vend la pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce tomate et de poissons frits. Adjouavi vend aussi de piments secs qu’elle achète au Ghana, pays frontalier au Bénin et de l’huile d’arachide. Grâce à ses activités, Adjouavi arrive à soutenir son mari dans les dépenses du ménage. Adjouavi s’approvisionne en maïs, poissons, condiments de sauce et huile d'arachide à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Adjouavi avait des problèmes de santé qui ont épuisé son fonds de commerce. C'est pourquoi Adjouavi s'est adressé à ALIDé en 2008 pour renforcer son capital et relancer ses activités. Dans la même optique, Adjouavi sollicite aujourd'hui encore l'appui financier de ALIDé pour ses activités.
texts.en:
H. Adjouavi was born around 1952 in Cotonou,  the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  She is married to EGBETOHOKPO Mathias, a shopkeeper.  Adjouavi and Mathias have five children who are all in school.  This family resides in Gbèdjromédé, a working-class district of the city of Cotonou.  She sells cornmeal mash served with tomato sauce and fried fish.  She also sells peanut oil and dried chili peppers, which she buys in Ghana, a country near Benin.  Thanks to her business, Adjouavi manages to support her husband in covering household expenses.  She stocks up on corn, fish, sauce condiments, and peanut oil at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin.  In 2008, Adjouavi inquired with ALIDé to bolster her capital and to reinvigorate her business.  With the same thing in mind now, she's again requesting ALIDé financial support for her business. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanut oil, corn, fresh fish, sauce condiments, charcoal, packaging for cornmeal mash, and canned beverages

loans.name: San Rafael Group

texts.es:
Este comité  SAN RAFAEL es un comité  que está en el decimo dentro de la Fundación Paraguaya cuenta con 20 integrantes las cuales realizan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales que les permiten aportar con los ingresos de la familia. Estás integrantes junto con sus actividades comerciales se describen a continuación.: .
Nº	Nombre y Apellido	Actividad
1	Juliana V..	Venta de frutas.
2	Fermina A. C..	Venta de mercería.
3	Petrona R. D..	Kiosco.
4	Rosalinda S. .	Peluquera.
5	Maria Z. D..	Modista.

6	Juana E. J..	Venta de Articulo de limpieza .
7	Alice R. M..	Venta de Ropas.
8	Norma B. Q..	Venta de quiniela.
9	Juana C. V..	Venta de ropas.
10	Lidia N. O..	Modista.
11	Gladys E. C..	Venta de ropas.
12	Catalina F. O..	Cocinera.
13	Estela G. deG.	Venta de artículos de limpieza.
14	Blanca B.M..	Peluquera.
15	Irma B.C..	Venta de cosméticos .
16	Jorgelina M..	Venta de productos Avon.
17	Concepcion V..	Venta de mercería.
18	Ines P. B..	Venta de comida.
19	Delia A.M..	Venta de quiniela.
20	Blanca L. D..	Venta de comestible.

Por Ej: La Sra Petrona R. D. posee un pequeño kiosko hace 7 años con la ayuda de su marido. Ella vende golosinas jugos gaseosas, comidas frías etc. Ingresó al comité con la idea de ampliar su pequeño negocio. .
Es un comité antiguo pero con  muchas ganas de superarse. .
texts.en:
This group SAN RAFAEL is in their tenth loan cycle through the Fundación Paraguaya (Paraguay Foundation). They have 20 members who have different types of businesses, which allow them to contribute to the family income. These members, along with their businesses, are described as follows:

Nº First and Last Name Activity 1 Juliana V.. Fruit sales 2 Fermina A. C.. Notions sales 3 Petrona R. D.. Kiosk 4 Rosalinda S. . Hairdresser 5 Maria Z. D.. Dressmaker 6 Juana E. J.. Cleaning products sales 7 Alice R. M.. Clothing sales 8 Norma B. Q.. Lottery tickets sales 9 Juana C. V.. Clothing Sales 10 Lidia N. O.. Dressmaker 11 Gladys E. C.. Clothing sales 12 Catalina F. O.. Cook 13 Estela G. deG. Cleaning products sales 14 Blanca B.M.. Hairdresser 15 Irma B.C.. Cosmetics sales 16 Jorgelina M.. Avon products sales 17 Concepcion V.. Notions sales 18 Ines P. B.. Food sales 19 Delia A.M.. Lottery ticket sales. 20 Blanca L. D.. Food sales

For example: Sra Petrona R. D. has owned a small kiosk for seven years, with the help of her husband. She sells candy, juices, sodas, cold foods, etc. She joined the committee with the idea of expanding her small business. It is an old committee but they have many desires to improve themselves.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase various merchandise such as: clothing, cosmetics, lottery cartons, fruits, vegetables, fabric, thread, food such as: meat, eggs, milk, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Djamilatou

texts.fr: Cette dame est mariée et est mère d’un enfant. Elle a ouvert en 2002 une boutique de vente de pagnes de qualité supérieure ; elle vend également des bijoux de très haute valeur. Sa boutique est bien connue de beaucoup de personnes, surtout les femmes d’affaire du secteur privé, les femmes fonctionnaires de l’administration publique. Elle reçoit ses commandes de bijoux de la France. Pour renouveler son stock de pagnes et de bijoux, elle souhaite avoir un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 15 pagnes Hitarget, 5 pagnes Wax, 10 pagnes Phoenix, et des boîtes de bijou de haute valeur. Sa boutique est située dans le quartier Adidoadin à Lomé.
texts.en:
This woman is married and the mother of one child. In 2002, she opened a boutique selling superior quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths). She also sells very valuable jewelry. Her store is well-known by many people, by all of the business women in the private sector and the female civil servants of the government. She receives orders for gems from France. To renew her stock of "pagnes" and jewelry, she is requesting a loan from WAGES (the micro-finance institution). She will use this loan to purchase 15 "Hitarget" brand "pagnes", 5 "Wax" brand "pagnes", 10 "Phoenix" brand "pagnes" and boxes of high-value jewels.

Her shop is located in the neighborhood of Adidoadin, in Lomé.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase high quality "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) and jewelry

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
General store is the business that manages by Alma P.. She plans to expand her store to be able to gain more income but she doesn’t have enough capital.  This is the reason why she is requesting to avail a loan amounting to PHP5, 000.00 to further expand her store. She would be glad if her request loan will be approved. 

Alma is 32 years old and she is married to Rodrigo. The couple is thankful because they are blessed with three children: Michael-13 years old; Mary Jane-10 years old, grade-VI and Melody Joy-8 years old. Expanding her store is the best thing that she can do in order to generate bigger income said by Alma.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 24 year old entrepreneur who runs a food kiosk in Muthurwa market of Nairobi. He has requested for his first loan of Ksh. 30,000 to enable him start a new business of selling second hand shoes. He hopes to educate his wife, start a business for her, build a home for his family in Nairobi and become an importer of shoes. He describes himself as trustworthy and social.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a new business

loans.name: Zulma

texts.es:
La señora Zulma A. , clienta nueva, es madre de dos hermosas niñas: Maria y Camila que fueron la inspiración para el nombre del negocio. Zulma es una mujer muy  trabajadora, ella se dedica a la venta de lencería, jeans, remeras, blusas, y vestimenta en general para dama y caballeros también accesorios de todo tipo. 
Sus principales clientelas son  personas del barrio y también clientela ya formada desde hace bastante años
Ella está en este rubro desde hace 7 años en la venta sobre pedido y ahora ya tiene su local propio en la ciudad de Asunción cerca de una de las oficinas de Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Zulma A., a new client, is the mother of 2 beautiful girls: Maria and Camila, that were the inspiration for the name of her business. Zulma is a very hard working woman; she sells lingerie, jeans, t-shirts, blouses, and other clothing for women and men, as well as a variety of accessories. Her main customers are locals from the area and also loyal customers she has had for many years. Zulma has worked in retail for 7 seven years selling clothing by catalog order and now has her own store space in Asunción city near the offices of Fundación Paraguaya.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise to increase her stock: t-shirts, pants, shirts, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Amevi

texts.fr: Cette femme habite le quartier Totsi à Lomé. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de chaussures pour femmes adultes et petites filles. Ce commerce lui permet d’apporter une aide financière à son mari cuisinier pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs enfants. Elle vend de maison en maison, ce qui fait qu’elle est bien connue de beaucoup de foyers. Actuellement son stock est presque épuisé ; c’est pour cela qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pou acheter 25 cartons de différents motifs de chaussures pour dames et 30 cartons de chaussures pour enfants.
texts.en:
This woman lives in the neighborhood of Totsi in Lomé. She is a traveling saleswoman of shoes for women and little girls. This business allows her to financially assist her husband, a cook, provide for their children's needs. She sells her wares house to house, which means that she is well-known in many homes.

Right now her stock is almost exhausted; it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, in order to purchase 25 boxes of various styles of shoes for women and 30 boxes of shoes for children.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shoes for adults and children

loans.name: K. Don Chirac

texts.fr: Ce monsieur s’est spécialisé dans le commerce D. prêt-à-porter dans sa petite boutique D. Kodjoviakopé à Lomé. Marié et père D. 02 enfants, il s’est lancé en 2007 dans le commerce D. prêt-à-porter pour dames ; cette activité lui permet donc D. subvenir aux besoins D. sa famille. Il reçoit ses commandes du Ghana mais aussi du Nigéria. Il a besoin d’un crédit D. WAGES pour commander 25 balles D. vêtements D. prêt-à-porter, pour renouveler son stock. Il a beaucoup D. clients D. la capitale et D. l’intérieur du pays.

loans.use: Achat de 25 bals de prêt à poter

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is a 34 year old father of 3 who lives and runs his tailoring business in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He has been in this business for the last five years after four years in employment. He has requested his third loan of Ksh. 20,000 after successfully repaying two loans. He intends to buy additional sewing machines and add stock of materials (fabric) with the loan money. He hopes to educate his children, start a business for his wife and start a tailoring school. He describes himself as hardworking and honest.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add stock & Buy additional sewing machines

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza D. T. of Barangay Biak na Bato, La Castellana, Negros Occidental is 40 years old and married with one child.  She operates a general store where she sells the usual groceries and commodities as well as frozen food and even ready-to-wear clothes. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 and the loans she has had access to have made a great impact on her business. Now she can even sell some of her products on credit to her neighbors because she has enough revolving capital. Allowing her neighbors to buy goods on credit and pay her back on an agreed-upon date has enabled Annaliza to have an edge over her competitors, and increased her income capacity.  Now on her 8th loan cycle, Annaliza is borrowing PHP 18,000 which she intends to use as a revolving fund for her store. Annaliza's dream is to provide her child with a good and comfortable future.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: For additional business capital.

loans.name: Germaire

texts.fr: A. Germaire est mariée à HOUNWANOU Agapith, un déclarant en douane. Germaire et Agapith ont 2 enfants, tous scolarisés et âgés respectivement de 7 ans et 5 ans.La famille réside à Sènadé depuis plus de 10 ans ; un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Germaine vend des divers (produits de toilettes et cosmétiques, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les piles, les bougies, etc.) dans sa boutique à côté de sa maison. Germaire s’approvisionne à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin. Germaire a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit à ALIDé; crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Pour accroître son étalage, Germaire sollicite son deuxième crédit de ALIDé.
texts.en:
A. Germaire is married to Hounwanou Agapith, a customs broker. Germaire and Agapith have two children, aged seven and five, who both attend school. For ten years the family has lived in Sènadé, a popular area in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.
Germaire sells various items (toiletries and cosmetics, milk, sardines, tomatoes, sugar, pasta, batteries, candles, etc.) in her shop next to her house. Germaire gets her supplies at Dantokpa, Benin’s big international market.
Germaire has already received and repaid a loan from Alidé. In order to expand her selection of products, Germaire is requesting her second loan through Alidé.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy toiletries, cosmetics, pasta, sugar, canned food, etc.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos G. is a 30 year old, newly married man who operates his pool business in Mukuru, Nairobi. He describes himself as social, friendly and God fearing.

Amos has been running his business for the last six months though he also works as a driver for public service vehicles. 

He has requested a first loan of KES 20000 in order to clear payment of the pool table. He desires to develop rental houses in Nairobi and give his family a good life.

Faulu Kenya

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Clear pool table payment.

loans.name: Akouvi Enyonam

texts.fr: Cette dame est une expérimentée du commerce d’alimentation générale à Lomé. Elle exerce cette activité depuis 2000 dans le quartier Kodomé à Lomé. Ce commerce lui permet d’aider financièrement son mari à subvenir aux besoins de leurs 04 enfants. Son commerce permet à beaucoup de gens du quartier de ne plus se rendre au marché en tout temps. Pour compléter son stock, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 20 pièces de poissons saumons fumés, 02 gros paniers de tomates naturelles, 01 sac d’haricot et 01 sac de maïs.

loans.use: Achatde poissons fumés, de tomates naturelles, de sacs d'haricot et de maïs

loans.name: Prosperidad Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su decimo  ciclo es un comité ejemplar. Las integrantes de este comité realizan distintos tipos de actividades comerciales en las que invierten el dinero de crédito con el fin de que el negocio vaya creciendo y aumentando sus ganancias. Estas actividades son:
1	Zunilda C. 	Manicurista
2	Lizza P.	Venta de Bebidas
3	Eva S.	Venta de Biyouteri
4	Blanca R.	Venta de comidas
5	Josefina G.	Venta de cd y películas
6	Liliana F.	Manicurista 
7	Eulalia C.	Venta de mercería
8	Francisca R.	Venta de lenceria
9	Gabriela V.	Venta de Lenceria
10	Lucia G.	Venta de golosinas
11	Gloria A.	Venta de cosmeticos
12	Mariana R.	Venta de ropas
13	Diana G.	Venta de comestibles
14	Clarise V.	Venta de mercerias|
15	Antonia A.	Costurera
16	Gladis N.	Venta de Articulos de limpieza
17	Jenny A.	 Venta de comestibles

Podemos hablar de la Sra. Zunilda C. de 40 años , tiene 3 hijos que dos de sus hijos pequeños se quedan en una guarderia  y los otros tres se quedan en la en la casa mientras la madre se va a trabajar haciendo sus manicuras y pedicuros en la zona de  Viñas Cue y los fines de semana se dedica a hacer  actividades con sus compañeras del comité para  crear una entrada más en sus ahorros como  por ejemplo hacen ferias y venta de hamburguesas. 
Ella es una señora muy  dedicada a sus hijos que hace de todo tipo de trabajo para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos de la familia.  
Tiene una casita  pequeña hecha de materiales  vive cerca de un desagüe que les hace pasar malos momentos y que piensa comprarse otra casita para su estabilidad y la de su familia.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias para la venta como frutas, verduras, carne, aceite, azúcar, lenceria, ropas, cd´s, golosinas, gaseosas, bijouterie,etc.

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a 49 year old father of six and grandfather to one. He lives and operates his matumbo meat (cow’s intestines) business in Mukuru slums of Nairobi. He has requested for a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable him start a second-hand shoe business. He hopes to educate his children and develop rental houses. He describes himself as social, friendly and determined.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start another business

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Ayawa est une dame qui habite le quartier Sagbado à Lomé. C’est une vendeuse ambulante de pagnes de différentes qualités. Elle est mariée et ce commerce lui permet d’apporter son aide financière à son mari pour subvenir aux besoins de leurs 02 enfants. Elle a débuté cette activité depuis 2001 ; elle dispose d’une clientèle qui lui est fidèle. Elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter 05 pagnes Super Wax, 05 pagnes Hitarget, 03 pagnes Soso. Depuis 3 mois déjà, elle  s’est lancée dans la vente d’articles scolaires. Ce prêt lui servira de plus à acheter 20 pièces de cahier de 100 pages, 15 pièces de cahiers de 200 pages ainsi que des bics et crayons.
texts.en:
Ayawa is a woman who lives in the neighborhood of Sagbado in Lomé. She is a traveling saleswoman, selling "pagnes" (colorful wax cloths) of differing qualities. She is married and this business enables her to help her husband pay for the needs of their 2 children. She has been in business since 2001; her clients are faithful to her. She is requesting a loan from WAGES (a micro-finance group) to pay for 5 "Super Wax" brand "pagnes", 5 "Hitarget" brand "pagnes" and 3 "Soso" brand "pagnes". For the past 3 months, she has also been selling school supplies. She will also use this loan to purchase 20 one-hundred page notebooks, 15 two-hundred page notebooks, in addition to pens and pencils.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase "pagnes" (colored wax cloths) and school supplies

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Amivi est une vendeuse ambulante de sachets en plastique. Ce commerce lui permet de se prendre en charge. Elle n’est pas mariée et elle n’a pas non plus d’enfant à sa charge. Elle a débuté ce commerce depuis 2004 dans le quartier Avénou à Lomé. Elle vend le plus souvent ses sachets à des vendeuses de tapioca, de farine, de maïs et bien d’autres produits alimentaires. Actuellement il ne lui reste que très peu de sachets ; c’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES  pour acheter 60 pièces de pros sachets noirs, 65 pièces de petits sachets noirs, 65 pièces de petits sachets blancs transparents, 60 pièces de sachets « bafana » pour les objets pesants.
texts.en:
Amivi sells plastic bags as she walks around town. Her business permits her to take of herself. She is not married and does not have any children to care for. She started her business in 2004 in the neighborhood of Avénou in Lomé. She mostly sells her bags to tapioca, flour, corn and other food salespeople.

Right now she does not have many bags left; this is why she is requesting a loan from the micro-finance group WAGES, in order to purchase 60 large black bags, 65 small black bags, 65 small transparent-white bags and 60 "bafana" bags for heavy objects.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a variety of plastic bags

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a 39 year old father of five. He lives in the Mukuru slums of Nairobi and runs a food kiosk. He has requested his first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable him start a cereals business. He has been in this business for the last thirteen years after eight years in employment. He desires to buy a piece of land, build a home and educate his children. He describes himself as social, patient and determined.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Start a cereals business

loans.name: Ernest Adera

texts.en:
Ernest Odera is a 38-year-old man married to Millicent.  He is the father of four children ages 3, 8, 9 and 10.  To make a living, he makes brake pads and other motor and bicycle rubber fittings from used tires. He has been running this business for about twenty years, next to a motor garage. His clients are mainly people who have their vehicles repaired at the garage, and the mechanics recommend him to their clients thanks to the business rapport that he has created. 

He learned about KADET Limited from his neighbor during an informal talk. This will be his first loan and he hopes to use the money to purchase more used tires, and expand his business by employing someone to assist him.  He aspires to open a motor spare parts shop, where he would include locally made and cheap rubber products, to serve a wider market segment.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy tires and hire an assistant.

loans.name: Oluyemissi

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de Cassablanca à Lomé. Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle a appris le métier de couture et c’est depuis 2005 qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle a beaucoup de clientes et dispose actuellement d’une apprentie couturière qui l’aide dans son travail. Elle ne dispose que d’une seule machine à coudre. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa clientèle, elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter une nouvelle machine à coudre. Cette machine sera destinée à son apprenti qui l’aidera dans l’exécution de ses tâches.

loans.use: Achat de machine à coudre

loans.name: Hannah Achieng

texts.en:
Hannah O., age 47, is a married mother of four. She raises pigs to sell to local butchers and sausage manufacturers. She has been in this business for four years, and in this period the demand for pork has increased steadily especially after her acceptance by the society.

Hannah learned about KADET from a friend. They both joined KADET to borrow funds that will enable them to increase the profitability of their businesses. This is Hannah's fifth loan and she will use it to complete a fattening pen that she started building but stalled due lack of funds. She aspires to expand the business and diversify into breeding ducks and chicken.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To build a fattening pen and buy pig feed.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is a thirty five year old mother who lives in Mukuru slums and operates a retail kiosk. She has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 to enable her add stocks of flour, soft drinks and other products. She desires to grow her business into wholesale, buy a piece of land, and educate her children. She describes herself as hardworking, patient and social.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add to stock

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance M. is a 41-year-old married mother of four children. She is married to Job Maitha and they live in Shanzu, Mombasa. Constance runs a food cafe in Shanzu and she has been in the business for 14 years. 

She is borrowing her first loan from KADET and plans to refurbish her cafe by cementing it. The family also depends on her husband's income who operates a taxi in Shanzu.  In future Constance hopes to establish a modern structure for her cafe so as to serve her customers better and to be more competitive. 

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To cement and refurbish her cafe.

loans.name: Etienne

texts.fr: G. Etienne est né vers les années 1955 à Abomey au centre du Bénin. Etienne est Etienne est père de 7 enfants tous scolarisés et dont 5 sont encore à sa charge. Etienne est marié à KPODOZAN Urbaine,  une revendeuse de divers (Bonbons, biscuits, boîtes de lait, de sardines, de tomates, de sucres, les pâtes alimentaires, les savons de lessive, de vaisselle et de toilette, piles, bougies, etc.). Etienne vend depuis 3 ans de charbon de bois et de pétrole lampant. Etienne est aussi un agent de sécurité bénévole dans une structure de la place. Etienne  et sa famille résident depuis 23 ans à  Agla, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou, Capitale Economique  de la République du Bénin. Etienne s’approvisionne en pétrole lampant dans les stations des sociétés pétrolières de la place. Etienne s’approvisionne en charbon de bois dans les villages du Bénin. Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce  Etienne a avait bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé qu’il a bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui encore Etienne sollicite un troisième crédit d’ALIDé pour agrandir son stock de charbon de bois et de pétrole lampant.

loans.use: Achat de charbon de bois et de pétrole lampant.

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a 28 year old newly married man. He operates a kitchenware business in the Muthurwa Market of Nairobi. He has requested a first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to add inventory of thermos, stoves and other products. He plans to own a supermarket and desires to build a home for his family and educate his children. He describes himself as jovial and social.


Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing access to financial opportunities. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Add inventory

loans.name: Maria

texts.fr:
Madame Maria Koné est une divorcée de 35 ans qui a deux enfants et habitant à Ouéléssébougou (une sous préfecture de la deuxième  région administrative de la république du Mali située à 80  kilomètres de Bamako). Maria vit dans un foyer monogame avec ses enfants.
Madame Maria Koné abandonna très tôt l’école pour des raisons de mariage qui ne tarderons pas à déboucher sur une mésentente d’où le divorce. Alors elle regagna sa ville natale et intégra le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de l’épanouissement de son activité génératrice : la vente de boissons d’une façon ambulante au niveau de la ville  dans un premier temps. Actuellement elle   est  devenue promotrice d’un  bar dénommé « BAR ESCALE ».  Elle est très appréciée et sollicitée par bien de clients de la ville et des villages environnants. 
Après quatre solidaires et un individuel, tous bien remboursés, elle est à son sixième prêt dont le deuxième en individuel. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt elle compte, constituer un stock important de boissons (gazeuses et alcoolisées) afin de faire une longue période sans rupture.
Elle est approvisionnée sur place par  livraison de son fournisseur et espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 110. 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera pour le paiement de ses échéances et subvenir à ses dépenses quotidiennes.
Madame Maria ambitionne en plus de son bar, être  dépositaire de boissons à Ouéléssébougou.

loans.use: Achat de boissons alcoolisées et gazeuses.

loans.name: Jumwa

texts.en:
Jumwa M. is a 60-year-old widow with two children, Amani and Tabu, who are ages 19 and 22.  Jumwa lives in Shanzu, Mombasa and has been running a grocery kiosk for the last six years. 

Jumwa learned about KADET through a client in Shanzu and she is glad to be accessing her first loan to finance her kiosk. With the loan she plans to purchase more vegetables and also refurbish her business premises. Her main customers are the residents of Shanzu town.

In the future Jumwa hopes to diversify by selling other foodstuffs in her store. She also hopes to establish a better and permanent retail store for her business.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en: Ivan owns a small retail business that sells various construction materials. He has been in this business for 6 years. He chose it because construction materials are in high demand. Offering delivery attracts more clients and helps Ivan to make better sales. Ivan is very responsible; he enjoys his business and has great plans for its growth! Ivan would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to increase the assortment of his inventories.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Lala

texts.fr:
Madame Lala  T. est une femme de quarante deux ans avec deux  enfants  qui vit dans une famille polygame traditionnelle à Sanankoroba, avec ses coépouses, leurs enfants  et leurs maris.(deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Après ses études secondaires (un certificat d’aptitude professionnelle en comptabilité), elle décide d’entreprendre des activités génératrices dans le domaine du commerce général. C’est ainsi  qu’elle intégra le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y a de cela six ans. 
Tous les quatre prêts précédents ont été bien remboursés et elle est à son cinquième prêt individuel destiné à la constitution d’un important stock de condiments et denrées alimentaires pour la restauration. 
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par semaine à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt 60  kilogrammes de condiments, une tonne de céréales diverses et des tubercules.
Elle espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 125. 000 FCFA qu’elle compte utiliser  pour rembourser les échéances du prêt et investir dans ses affaires.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lala T. is a 42 year old woman with two children; she lives in a traditional polygamous family in Sanankoroba, with her co-spouses, their children and their husbands. They live in the second Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali.

After secondary school (where she gained a certificate in professional aptitude in accounting), she decided to start a income-generating business in the area of general commerce. She has also belonged to the micro-finance organization Soro Yiriwaso for the past 6 years. She fully repaid her preceding four loans and she is on her fifth individual loan, which she intends to use to stock condiments and general food stuffs for her restaurant. She supplies herself once a week in Bamako and with this loan she intends to purchase 60 kilograms of condiments, one ton of various grains and root vegetables. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 125,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and invest in her business.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase food stuffs for her restaurant

loans.name: Kamba

texts.fr:
Kamba B. est une célibataire, mère de deux enfants qui vit à Sanankoroba localité située à 20  kilomètres de Bamako (capitale du Mali) dans une famille traditionnelle élargie avec ses frères, soeurs et biens d’autres parents.
Pour des raisons sociales, elle abandonna les études au lycée (niveau enseignement secondaire dans le système éducatif Malien) pour entreprendre le petit commerce d’articles divers. 
Dans ses recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elle fait recours au programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant deux ans.  
Elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel après avoir bien remboursé le premier.
Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois à Bamako et compte avoir avec ce prêt 5 douzaines de flacon de parfum, 2 douzaines de draps de lits et une quantité suffisante d’articles divers pour femme qu’elle vend en ambulant et espère réaliser un bénéfice  mensuel de 60.000 FCFA.
Ce bénéfice servira à  subvenir à ses dépenses et rembourser les échéances du prêt.
texts.en:
Kamba B., a single mother of two children, lives in Sanankoroba, a town located 20km from Bamako (the capital of Mali). She lives in a traditional family along with her brothers, sisters and lots of other relatives.
For social reasons, she quit her high school studies (at the secondary schooling level of Mali’s education system) to run a small business selling a variety of items.
Looking to supplement her financial resources, she turned to Soro Yiriwaso’s credit program two years ago.
She is on her second individual loan after having repaid the first.
She stocks up once a month in Bamako and, with this loan, she plans to buy five dozen bottles of perfume, two dozen sets of sheets and a sufficient quantity of various women’s items, which she sells on foot. She hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 XOF.
These profits will help her to cover her expenses and make her loan repayments.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Susan Auma

texts.en:
Susan Auma is 37 years old and married to Samuel. They have three children ages 15, 11, and 10. She has been selling household utensils and tools for three years, during which she has increased her stock and products.  She aspires to run the business in a permanent building and offer larger quantities. 

She had a challenge getting credit because the informal village savings group she belonged to did not give loans and members could only access their savings refunds upon exit or from small emergency-only loans. It was only after a friend who was a co-member in the savings group informed her about KADET that she was able to access a loan. This will be her second loan and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. She has also engaged a local tinsmith for regular supplies of cheap locally-made household tools.

About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services in order to  relieve suffering and improve living conditions in communities across Kenya.

loans.use: To buy more stock of household items.

loans.name: Victoire

texts.fr: K. Victoire est née vers 1962 à Kétenou. Victoire est mariée à KOUTON Michel, un ferrailleur. Victoire et Michel ont quatre enfants. La famille vit à Finangnon à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Victoire et son mari assurent ensemble les dépenses du ménage. C’est les fruits que Victoire vend. Victoire achète ses fruits à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin et les vend dans son quartier à Finangnon. Victoire a déjà quatre ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Victoire a déjà bénéficié pour son activité de six crédits d’ALIDé. Victoire rembourse bien ses crédits. Pour augmenter le volume de son activité et diversifier ses ventes à d’autres fruits, Victoire sollicite son septième crédit d’ALIDé.
texts.en:
K. Victoire was born around 1962 in Kétenou. She is married to KOUTON Michel, a scrap metal merchant.  Victoire and Michel have four children.  The family lives in Finangnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Together she and her husband make sure that household expenses are covered.  Victoire sells fruit.  She purchases supplies of fruit at Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, and sells them in Finangnon.  She already has four years of experience in this business.  She benefited before from six ALIDé loans for her business and has repaid them.  To increase her business volume and to diversify her sales with other fruit, she's requesting her 7th loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit:  pineapples, oranges, and bananas

loans.name: Presella

texts.en:
Presella S., 36, lives in the outskirts of the BASECO Compound in Tondo, Manila.  Her husband works at the pier.  Their only child is now in elementary school.

Presella has been a dealer of household liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) in cylinders.  Most households in her community relyon LPG for cooking so she makes good business.  She also sells electronic credits for mobile phones.  Combined, she earns P16, 000.00 a month.  

She has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative since 2006.  She has finished repaying her previous loan with CCT.  She used the previous loan in her new venture – selling RTW (ready-to-wear) clothing.  Now on her 9th loan cycle, she is requesting a new loan in the amount of P17, 000.00 as additional capital for her clothing business. 


About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for new business - clothing sales

loans.name: Azucena

texts.en:
Azucena M. of Sitio Buringot, Barangay Odiong, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental is a 57-year-old married mother of 8 adult children. Her husband earns a living by driving a carabao-driven cart that he hires out to haul farm products for neighboring farms.

Azucena joined NWTF 11 years ago when her youngest was still a teenager. She used her first loan of PHP 3,000 to buy goats and chickens to raise and sell, and it was a lucrative venture for her. In a later loan, she borrowed enough capital to purchase a female carabao to breed. Now she is breeding and raising several livestock which is providing her family with a good source of income. With her business venture going well, she was able to repair her house.

For her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Azucena wants to borrow PHP 18,000 so that she could buy more livestock to raise and later sell at a profit. Even if her children are all adults she still wants to help them and their families, especially her grandchildren, to have a better and more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women.
