Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: To buy more livestock.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
This is Imelda A., 40 years old from Baseco Compound, Port Area, Manila.  Her husband Rodelito, 47, is a welder.  They have four kids, all attending school.

Imelda has a general store situated just in front of her house.  In front of the store, she also sells cooked foods.  She has been enjoying running her business for the last eight years and now earns close to P18,000.00 a month.   

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2003.  She is now on her 10th loan cycle and has applied for a new loan in the amount of P16,000.00.  She will stock more items to sell at her store to include school supplies.  

She wants to see her general store in the future to be bigger than what it is now so she could help employ some of her neighbors.  She also dreams of opening a restaurant soon.



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To stock additional items for her general store including school supplies

loans.name: Momagul

texts.ru: Нурхонова Момагул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 56 лет. Женат, имеет 4  детей. Муж вместе с сыном работают на земле. Сама Момагул более 15 лет занимается продажей скота. Она откармливает и продает скот не рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Msasani Group

texts.en:
Redson M., age 60, is married with six grownup children.   He has owned a general store business since 1970.  He works from 6.30am to 10pm daily and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $153. 

This will be Redson’s fouth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to renovate his house and increase his business and has paid the loans back successfully. He now hopes for a new loan to grow the store and to paint his house.

Redson  will share this loan with subgroup A of the Msasani group. The subgroup has 6 members, who are shopkeepers, drivers, grocery store owners and masons.  These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Redson is second from right in a blue t-shirt.

loans.use: To inrease inventory and paint his house.

loans.name: Zamonkul

texts.ru: Одинаев Замокул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 45 лет. Женат имеет 4 детей. Замонкул имеет среднее образование. Он более 10 лет занимается животноводством, т.е. он откармливает и продает скот на рынке. Кредит просит для закупа скота и в дальнейшем его продажи.
texts.en:
Zamonkul O. is a 45-year-old, married father of four, living in the Yavana district. Zamonkul has secondary education. For more than ten years, he has been involved in raising animals, in that he takes care of livestock and sells them at the market. The loan request is to purchase livestock and to sell them in the long term.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Nonelia

texts.en:
Nonelia S. is from the village of Landing. She is 56 years old. Nonelia is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Nonelia owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Nonelia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Nonelia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nonelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. Nonelia is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to finance her pig raising project. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nonelia from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For Rice Production

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
This is Vilma H., 36 years old, from Malibay, Pasay City.  Her husband Eric, 39, is an auto mechanic.  They have three school-aged children.

Vilma sets up a table in an alley near their house and sells food items which she herself cooks every day.  She also serves fruit shakes of different flavors.  She makes good sales every day primarily because of her business location.  She earns at least P13,000.00 a month.  Recently, she added selling French fries.  At times, she also provides home-based manicures and pedicures services to customers, which is another sure source of additional income for her.    

She joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2003 and has since been enjoying the many benefits it provides for its members.  Vilma has applied recently for a loan from CCT for P15,000 for expanding her business.  

Vilma works hard because she wants her children to finish school.  She hopes to formalize her stall into a full-blown restaurant someday.  She also dreams of having her own parlor.        



About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice.  This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context.  It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.  

CCT is a member of the Five Talents Family.

loans.use: For additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es:
Benedicto tiene 51 años, vive en pareja con Mirta de 49 años de edad. De la unión de  ambos han nacido 3 hijas de 21, 18 y 13 años de edad respectivamente.
Benedicto es un sacrificado hombre que trabajó varios años en  la Argentina, desempeñándose como constructor de obras. Trabajó  como casi 20 años, allí conoció a la que hoy día es su actual pareja y del dinero que pudo ahorrar durante ese tiempo vino a quedarse ya en su país, que es el Paraguay. 
Una vez instalados en  su país de origen, lograron emprender juntos su propio negocio. Actualmente la señora posee una pequeña despensa en su domicilio y  Benedicto tiene una parada de taxi en  Itá, ciudad de la cual ambos son oriundos. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y la ayuda de su pareja hoy en día  ya cuenta con dos vehículos que emplea en dicha actividad. 

Comenta  Benedicto que se siente muy orgulloso del trabajo y de su compañera por el apoyo constante que le brinda. 

En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de cubiertas y algunas otras cosas como baterías para su vehículo de manera a ponerlo a punto y así brindar un mejor servicio a sus numerosos pasajeros.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 51. He lives with his partner, Mirta, who is 49. They have three children ages 21, 18, and 13. Benedicto is a sacrificing man who worked various years in Argentina. He worked in construction for almost 20 years, and he met Mirta there. With the money he was able to save during that time, he was able to return to his country, Paraguay, to stay. Once back in his country, together they were able to start their own business. She currently has a small store in her home. Benedicto has a taxi service in Itá, the city they are both from. Thanks to his effort and help from Mirta, he now has two cars, which are used in the taxi service. He feels very proud of his work and of Mirta for the help she constantly gives him. He is asking for a loan to buy tires and other things like batteries for his vehicle. He will tune up his vehicle and then be able to offer better service to his numerous passengers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy tires, batteries and others

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan J. is from the town of Baliangao. She is 31 years old. Joan is married and has 1 school-aged child. Joan owns & operates a specialized retail store selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Joan has just started this business.

In 2004, Joan joined PMPC to gain access to the financial services to help improve her living situation by running a business. Joan has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Joan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Joan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Inez

texts.en:
Inez Q. is a single woman from Hacienda Sandra, Bato, Brgy. Odiong, Moises Padilla, Negros Occidental. She just turned 60.

In 1998, she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she needed capital to sustain her farm. When she received her first loan of PHP 3,000, she used some of it to buy fertilizer and the balance she used to buy milled rice to resell, which enabled her to have a cash flow to pay for her weekly dues. 

On her third loan, she bought a breeding sow and farmed out the piglets to her neighbors to raise, splitting the profits with them. Now she has five breeding sows and her arrangement with her neighbors has proven to be a lucrative venture for all involved. Over the years, she expanded her farming venture and her rice business continues to flourish. Inez is such a dedicated member that she has won the best member award several times. 

Now on her 14th loan, Inez is borrowing PHP 18,000 to buy seeds to grow on her farm.

As a single woman, Inez is working hard while she is able so that she will be financially secure and independent in her golden years.

In the picture, Inez is shown standing on the drying platform of newly harvested rice, which is usually sun-dried before it is sent to the rice mill.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Seeds to grow on her farm

Helen is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale particularly banana cue vending. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Helen from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Фотима Файзова проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 55 лет. Замужем, имеет 8 детей. Муж вместе с сыном работают на стройке. Сама Фотима более 15 лет занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. Еще помимо этого они имеют теленка, молоко которого продают односелчанам. Кредит просит для закупа скота.
texts.en:
55-year-old Fotima F. lives in the Yavana region with her husband and eight children. Her husband and sons work in construction. Fotima has been engaged in raising animals for more than 15 years. She tends the livestock then sells them. Besides that, she has dairy cows whose milk she sells to her fellow villagers. The loan request is to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by JD Bergeron, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: May

texts.en:

May owns & operates a business venture selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. May has been in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 1,980.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, May joined PMPC to help improve her living situation by gainning access to financial services and capital. May is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by May from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the her business.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: José

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años, está casado con  Mariela, también de 33 años de edad. De esta  unión nació 1 hijo que hoy día cuenta con 2 años de edad.
José es un sacrificado hombre que junto con su padre se dedica a la a la fabricación y venta de artículos de vidrio, como ser  vitrinas, exhibidores, polarizados y divisorias  para oficinas. 
Él comenta que desde muy pequeño le gustó la actividad que realizaba su padre, tal es así que hoy día él es el encargado de administrar el negocio y realiza los trabajos en forma diaria. Está muy agradecido con su trabajo por que gracias a eso pudo terminar sus estudios, y recibirse como  Contador Público, profesión que ejerce a la par de su actividad como vidriero. 
En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de mayor cantidad de materia prima (vidrios),debido a que su actividad posee mucha demanda y quiere aprovechar al máximo para aumentar su producción y consecuentemente sus ingresos.
texts.en:
José is 33. He is married to Mariela, who is also 33. They have a two year old child. José is a sacrificing man. He and his father work together making and selling glass articles like shop windows, showcases, tinted glass, and dividers for offices. Since he was very small, he liked the work his father did. So it is that today he is in charge of administering the business. He does the work every day. He is very grateful because thanks to the work, he was able to finish his educations and become a Public Accountant. He practices this profession in his work as a glass worker. He is asking for a loan to buy a larger quantity of raw material (glass) due to the large demand for his work. He wants to take maximum advantage of the demand and increase his production to consequently increase his income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy glass

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is from the village of Pta.Sulong,Baliangao Mis. Occ.. She is 43 years old. Eva is married and has 2 school-aged children. Eva owns and operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. Eva has been working in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000.00 PHP a month.

In 2004, Eva joined PMPC to help improve her living situation by gainning access to financial services and capital. Eva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. Eva is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed for rice production. This loan will be the 9th loan taken out by Eva from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the school tuition of the her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.es:
La señora Nicanora tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos que aún viven con ella. Posee una despensa en su domicilio ubicado en un conocido barrio de la ciudad de Itá donde provee a sus clientes antiguos y a ocasionales de yerba, bebidas en general, carne, panificados, lácteos y otras mercaderías hace más de 10 años. 
La misma se inició en el ámbito financiero gracias del pequeño préstamo que recibió por parte de la Fundación Paraguaya en cuyos cumplimientos demostró buena moral de pago, lo cual la ayudó con el tiempo a acceder a mayores préstamos y de forma a ir acrecentando mas clientes y por ende mayores ventas en su negocio, pudiendo así mejorar de nivel de vida y  la de fu familia.
texts.en:
Nicanora is 50, married, and has two children who still live with her. She has a small store in her home, which is located in a well known neighborhood in the city of Itá. She has provided her old and her occasional customers with herbs, general drinks, meat, bread, dairy products, and other merchandise for over ten years. She started the business thanks to a small loan she received from the Fundación Paraguaya. She demonstrated good ethics in making her payments. In time, that helped her to access greater loans, which in turn gave her more customers and greater sales. Then she was able to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy meat, drinks, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

texts.en:

In 2009, Merlyn joined PMPC to improve her living situation by gaining access to financial services and capital. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used for working capital and to purchase additional inventory. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Merlyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About PMPC:

Stephania K., age 53, is single with two children ages 33 and 35.  She lives with her mother. She has a fish business which she started in 1998.  She works daily from 6am until 11pm.  She is able to earn a monthly profit of $31.
 
This will be Stephania’s 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Stephania will share this loan with her loan group  Mucharuko, which totals 15 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Stephania is 3rd from right front row..

loans.use: To increase fish sales

loans.name: Utamurod

texts.ru: Юсупов Утамурод проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 47 лет. Женат, имеет  5 детей. Сын находится на военной службе. Сам Утамурод занимается предоставлением услуги такси. Оне также занимается животноводством, откармливанием и продажей скота. Кредит просит для закупа скота.

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Mrs. Norma B. is a resident of Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City. She is married to Rosendo B. and has four school age children.

Mrs. B.’s husband is a tricycad driver. A tricycad is a bicycle with three wheels which is commonly used for transportation here in downtown Ozamiz City. He is also engaged in green algae culture, which in Filipino native language is known as “guso”- a green algae or seaweed. Mrs. B. also sells snack food in her neighborhood on Sundays but their daily source of living comes from her husband’s tricycad operation for which he earns Php 300 per day.

Mrs. B. joined PMPC in 2006 and her first loan was Php 3,000 which she used as additional payment of the tricycad which she had bought. Right now she is applying for her 8th loan in the amount of Php 14,000 intended to purchase spare parts and pay for repairs to her husband’s tricycad.

Mrs. B.’s future plans for her family are to be able to send her four children to college and to be able to make a comfortable house since they are living near the seashore and, during high tide, the water gets inside their house. She is hoping and praying that through the help of PMPC and Kiva lenders she will fulfill her future plans.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her husband's tricycad

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La Señora Clara de 54 años de edad es comerciante y está casada con el Señor Anastacio  de 51 años de edad, con quien tuvo 2 hijos, Laura de 20 años, quien trabaja en un supermercado y  Osmar de 19 años quien se encuentra cursando el primer año de la Carrera de Derecho en la Universidad del Norte. 
Clara se dedica a la elaboración y venta de alimentos de todo tipo. Comenzó su actividad hace más de 14 años, con  mucho esfuerzo y la ayuda de toda su familia pudo salir adelante ya que su marido perdió su trabajo y como consecuencia de ello tuvo la iniciativa de preparar comidas que se encargan de comercializar su hijo y su esposo. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales  para un nuevo salón comercial cuya construcción ya ha iniciado, el mismo destinará para montar allí una despensa. Aún así continuará con el negocio de venta de comidas que le generan muy buenos ingresos. 
Está muy entusiasmada con la inauguración de su nuevo negocio debido a que el mismo le generará más ingresos y ello implicará más ganancias y mejor nivel de vida para ella y toda su familia.
texts.en:
Clara is 54 years old, a merchant, and married to Anastacio who is 51. They have 2 children, Laura who is 20 and works in a supermarket, and Osmar who is 19 and currently in the first year in law school at the University of the North.

Clara makes and sells foods of all kinds. She began doing this more than 14 years ago, and with great effort and much support from everyone in her family, she has been able to continue, despite the fact that her husband lost his job. As a consequence, she took the initiative to prepare meals which her son and husband took charge of selling.

She is requesting this loan to buy materials for a new commercial area, whose construction is already begun. It is intended for marketing. Thus she will continue with the business of selling meals which generates very good income.

Clara is very excited with the inauguration of her new business since this will generate more income and it means greater earnings and a better standard of living for her and all her family.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CONSTRUCTION OF A DINING AREA FOR HER CATERING BUSINESS

loans.name: Beverly

texts.en:
Beverly D. is from the village of Mialen,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Beverly is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Beverly owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Beverly has been engaged in her business for over 36 years and earns approximately 4,000.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Beverly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Beverly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Beverly is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Beverly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga P. is from the village of Pan-ay,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is 55 years old. Dominga is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Dominga owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 700.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Dominga joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Dominga is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Dominga from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Tojikul

texts.ru: Точикул Юсуфова проживает в районе Яван. Возраст 41 год. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Муж вместе с сыном работают на частной стройке. Сама Точикул дома занимается животноводством. Она откармливает и продает скот. У нее имеются постоянные клиенты. Кредит просит для закупа скота.

loans.use: Закуп скота

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego tiene 27 años de edad, vive en pareja con Julia de 25 años de edad, ambos tienen un hijo de 2 años.
Diego comenta que junto con sus hermanos se dedican a la producción y elaboración de panificados. Desde hace mas de 15 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. 
Comenzó a trabajar desde   muy joven  a la edad de 8 años ya que trabajaba con su padre  en la panadería que hasta hoy día poseen. Cabe mencionar también que sus actividades diarias  empiezan desde muy tempranas horas, a las 2 de la mañana ya comienzan sus actividades de producción de panificados, y que para el amanecer ya deben tener el producto terminado para así poder  realizar su reparto a varios negocios de la zona en el cual vende sus productos terminados, que por cierto son muy requeridos por su numerosa  clientela. 

En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima, tales como: harina, leña, levadura, etc.  debido a que tiene una oferta que desea aprovechar.
texts.en:
Diego is 27 years old. He lives with Julia who is 25 years old. Together they have a two year old son. Diego, together with his brothers, produces and bakes bakery items. For over fifteen years he has been doing this activity. He began working with his brother when he was eight years old and he worked with his father in the bakery that they currently own. He would like to also mention that their daily work begins early in the morning. At two in the morning they begin to make the bakery items. They need to have their products finished before daybreak so that they can deliver them to various businesses in the neighborhood. These businesses sell the baked goods that are sought after by many customers. He is taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy essential materials such as flour, wood, yeast etc. This is an opportunity that he would like to grab.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour, wood, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en: Natalia M. is a resident of Gusa, Calatunan, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 50 years old, married with 8 children. Her husband is a farmer. She is a member in good standing and she is now in the third cycle of her loan. Her business is food vending. She started her business by house-to-house vending with a little capital she was able to access from Paglaum. In the future, she hopes to own a store where she can display goods.

loans.use: Additional capital for food vending

loans.name: Edelmira

texts.es:
Edelmira tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos de los cuales  algunos viven con ella y otros ya formaron su propia familia. 
La señora Edelmira emigró de la ciudad de Caraguataity a un populoso barrio de la ciudad de Itá hace 21 años en busca de mejor su nivel de vida. 
 En dicha ciudad montó una despensa donde surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales de carne, leche, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otros insumos de primera necesidad hace más de 15 años. 
El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de dichos insumos a modo a aumentar su stock de mercaderías y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Edelmira is 52 years old and has seven children, some of which live with her and others that have their own family. Twenty-one years ago Edelmira moved to the city of Caraguataity, a populated community in the city of Ita. She moved here to improve her quality of life. In this city she began a small grocery store where she provides her neighbors and others meat, milk, sugar, yerba (a type of tea), general drinks and other necessary goods. She has been doing this for fifteen years. The loan that she is requesting will be used to purchase new goods to increase her stock of grocery goods. In this way she will improve her family’s income

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, general drinks, flour, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina D. is from the town of Jimenez. She is 60 years old. Regina is widowed and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a snack-vending business venture making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community.

Regina has been engaged in her business for over 9 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2002, Regina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Regina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther H. is from the village of Upper Centro,Tudela,Misamis Occidental. He is 58 years old. Esther is married and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Esther owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Esther has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 1,200.00 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Esther joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Esther is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Esther from PMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda J. is from the village of Pan-ay, Claarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Cresilda is married and has 3 children. To make a living, Cresilda owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Cresilda is just starting this business.

In 2009, Cresilda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cresilda is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Cresilda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Fernanda

texts.en:
Fernanda B. is a 43-year-old businesswoman from Camarin, Caloocan City who loves to multi-task. Her husband Gilbert, 45, is a jeepney (bus) driver. They have six children; one is in college, two are in high school, and the three others are in elementary school.

Fernanda has a general store which has been around for about fifteen years. Much of her time and effort is focused on this business but she also gets to engage in direct-selling of shoes, cosmetics, and apparel provided by prominent direct-selling companies (Natasha, Boardwalk, etc.). All these business activities give Fernanda a sure income of almost Php 15,000 a month.

A jolly and friendly woman, Fernanda joined the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative in 2007. She was happy to learn that most of her neighbors were also members of the cooperative. She has learned from the CCT the value of saving for the future. She wishes to see all her children finish their education.

Fernanda applied for a new loan with the cooperative amounting to Php 12,000 as additional capital for the continuity of her businesses.

About CCT

The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ.

CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: additional capital for her general store

loans.name: Jona

texts.en:
Mrs. Jona M. is 38 years old, married, and has seven children ages 3 to 17. She is a resident of Hacienda Dama, Cabacungan, La Castellana, Negros Occidental.

Jona became a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon on October 4, 2004. She remembers that date because it was a turning point in her life. As she tells it, it was through NWTF-Project Dungganon that she was able to build a viable business, repair their house, add a comfort room, and have enough income to send her children to school.

Today, Jona sells ice cream and "barquillos" or rolled wafer sticks, owns a "sari-sari" or general store, and breeds pigs for sale. Jona is very optimistic about the future of her children because she knows that she has financial backing with NWTF as long as she remains a good member and works hard to reach her goals.

For her 11th loan, Jona is asking to borrow PHP 15,000 to add to her capital for her many business ventures. She intends to use the profits for her family's daily needs and to set aside a certain amount for the future security of her family.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation Inc. has answered the calling of not just of a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a $1 a day to surpassing the realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her diversified business ventures

loans.name: Corsini

texts.en:
Corsini N. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 38 years old. Corsini is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Corsini owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling gasoline in the local community. Corsini has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Corsini joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corsini is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Corsini from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gulmira's Group

texts.en:
39-year-old Gulmira R. has three children. Her eldest son, 17, lives in a village with his grandmother. Her second son is 15 and her daughter is just four and half years old. Her and her husband hold interesting occupations as toastmasters in various feasts and banquets during weekends. Previously, her husband used to work in an entertainment centre; now he is an art director in a vocational school. 

They have already taught the basics of their occupation to their middle son. Now he occasionally assists them during banquets. They enjoy doing their job because it provides an income and gives them a lot of free time during the week. Saving little by little, they have able to buy audio equipment and speakers. They understand to survive the competition they constantly have to seek ways to improve the quality of their services. Gulmira hopes to obtain a loan to buy a video camera as it has become essential to organize feasts and parties. In the near future, they plan to organize a band and buy sound equipment for their son so that he is able to work separately. 

Gumira has three loan partners: Gulsaira, Zinagul and Maria. Gulsaira, 42, is a widow with two children. Since the collapse of Soviet Union she has been engaged in commerce near a hospital. Now she plans to sell foodstuffs at school. She needs a loan to purchase goods and foodstuffs in order to increase turnover. With the return, she would pay for her daughter’s education. 

Zinagul, 44, is a mother of five children. Besides being a housewife, she helps her husband raise the livestock. Zinagul needs a loan to buy a milk cow in order to sell milk.

Maria, 50, is married and has six children. Her husband and son raise cattle while she manufactures traditional articles. In her spare time, she helps her husband look after cattle. Maria wants to obtain a loan to open up a shop as there are few of them in the area.
 
  ======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy a video camera

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre María Auxiliadora, se conformó en fecha 03 de agosto del 2006, gracias a que la actual Directora General, la Sra. María Ana A., quien se dedica a la venta de pollos y panificados, contactó con la asesora en una reunión semanal que la misma tenía en la zona para enterarse de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras. 
 Una vez asesorada acerca del programa logró juntar a 17 mujeres quienes se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto ya en el 11º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
 
Durante todo el transcurso de estos ciclos han demostrado un excelente cumplimiento de pago, las mismas gracias al apoyo crediticio recibido con este programa han logrado sobresalir grandemente en cada una de sus actividades, han demostrado una vez mas que las mujeres son pilares esenciales dentro de una familia y que las mismas también pueden superarse cada día mas.
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de  905.882 Gs., lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de comidas, venta de mercerías, venta de mercaderías para la despensa (arroz, azúcar, fideos, lácteos, panificados, yerba, etc.) venta de ropas, venta de plantas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de perfumes, venta de productos Avon, venta de pollos y panificados, etc. 
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya.
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.

loans.use: Compra de mercaderías varias como: arroz, azúcar, yerba, lácteos, panificados, gaseosas, etc., ropas , artículos para la mercería, compra de lencerías, ,compra de frutas y verduras, compra de perfumes, compra de plantas, compra de productos Avon, compra de pollos e ingredientes para la elaboración de panificados, etc.

loans.name: Jursun's Group

texts.en:
Jursun is a 46 year old mother with three children. Since her son, 21, and daughter, 18, both go to college, Jursun and her husband realized they would have to pay for their education. Her husband works as a builder at a construction site. Jursun quickly realized her opportunity to help her husband support the family. Since many villagers grow strawberries, Jursun has decided to purchase strawberries wholesale and resell in the city of Almaty in Kazakhstan. She took a risk by investing $240 in this undertaking and now provides herself with a monthly income of $140. 

Her family has been able to make some repair at home not to mention paying her two children’s tuition fees. Jursun now needs a loan to purchase large amount of strawberries as she wants to increase her profits. With money earned, she will be able to buy curtains and a carpet. Now, she has an enthusiastic plan of opening a shop near her house. She is certain that this shop will be successful since her house is next to a local school. 
 
Jursun’s loan partners are Gulmira, Gulnara and Jamilya. Gulmira, 45, is a mother of two daughters. She works in local municipality and her husband works as a guard in security service of a local company. Gulmira needs a loan to buy a water compressor.
 
Gulnara, 46, is a widow. She has three daughters, two of whom are married and help their mother. To make a living Gulnara grows strawberries and sells eight buckets every two days. This way, she manages to earn $215 a month. She needs a loan to buy one hectare of irrigated land to plant more strawberries.
 
Jamilya, 54, is a housewife and mother of three children. She keeps six cows and sells forty liters of milk daily makes $215 a month. Her husband works in a TV station.  Jamilya hopes to get a loan to purchase hay for winter time. 
======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy large amount of strawberries

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife E. is a 38-year-old micro-entrepreneur, living at Gango, Ozamis City, and is happily married to Ramil. They have only one child. Her husband is a painter and her own source of income comes from her little grocery store located in their house. She started her business back in 1995 with the starting capital of Php 5,000 which was taken as a loan from her husband's salary. With this, she earns a monthly net income of Php 3,000.

Through the encouragement of her friends and neighbors who are members of PMPC she decided to join the Co-op. Right now she is applying for her first loan amounting to Php 5,000 as additional capital to purchase grocery stock for her grocery store. She deeply wishes to send her child to school and be able to renovate her house someday.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery stock

loans.name: Patria

texts.en:
Mrs. Patria C., 47 years of age, married but separated with her husband is a resident of P1 Sumirap, Tangub City. She had 2 children who are now in their high school years. Her live-in partner is a motorcycle driver with an average net income of not less than P200.00 a day. With the support of her live-in partner now a day, she was able to send her children at school. 
Presently, Mrs. Patria is engaged in sari-sari store business and a little rice retailing activity in their barangay. She started this kind of business since year 2002. Now, her business is still in stable condition and progressing in which she is earning an average net income of not less than P6,000.00 a month. For 1 year already, she maintains a good credit record in our cooperative and able to availed 2 cycles of loan. Now, she is applying an amount of P14,000.00 as her 3rd loan availment to add her capital for her existing sari-sari store business. 
Her only dream in life is to be able to give her children a better future from her hard works with the help of our Lord and through the financial assistance from our cooperative.

loans.use: Additional capital for her Sari-sari Store business

location.town: P1 Sumirap, Tangub City, Mis. Occ.

loans.name: Mujeres Progresistas Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres de nombre Mujeres Progresistas, se conformó en fecha 20 de julio del 2009, gracias a que la Directora General, la Sra. Benigna A., quien se dedica a la venta de lencería, ya había participado del programa y ya en conocimiento de la forma de trabajo que tiene el Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, se comunicó con la  asesora para volver a trabajar con la Fundación Paraguaya. La misma logró juntar a 21 mujeres y hoy día se encuentran trabajando muy a gusto, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa en este 1° ciclo que están comenzando. 
El promedio de crédito retirado por cada integrante es de   300.000 Gs.,lo cual va destinado para diferentes actividades tales como: venta de bebidas, venta de ajo, venta de productos de limpieza, venta de ropas (mercería),venta de mandioca, venta de telas, venta de almohadas, venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comidas, etc. 
Todas ellas realizan actividades para recaudar fondos, se ayudan mutuamente para llegar a los objetivos en común que todas tienen dentro del grupo y con la Fundación Paraguaya. 
Participan activamente en las reuniones semanales y tienen un trabajo solidario impecable.
texts.en:
The group of women known as Mujeres Progresistas was formed on July 20, 2009 thanks to the fact that the General Director, Mrs. Benigna A., who works selling linens and had participated in the Enterprising Women Group (Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras) program and knew how the program worked, contacted the advisor in order to go back to working with the Fundación Paraguaya. She was able to bring 21 women together that are now comfortably working together as a supportive team during the first cycle of the program that is now beginning. The average amount borrowed on credit of each member is 300Gs. which goes toward their endeavors such as the sale of beverages, garlic, cleaning products, clothing (notions), cassava, fabrics, pillows, fruits and vegetables, food, etc.

All these women work toward paying back the money through their sales, working together to reach the common objectives that all the women of the Fundación Paraguaya share.

They all actively participate in weekly meetings and have formed an impeccable collective effort.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica McBride, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for food, linens, articles to make cleaning products, manioc, beverages, fabric, cosmetics, pillows, fruits and vegetables, garlic, dry goods, etc.

loans.name: Shaiyr's Group

texts.en:
Shaiyr is the leader of this loan group. She has three children. Her eldest daughter is married and lives separately. Her eldest son works in a canning plant in Russia and her youngest son, 14, is a school student. Many years ago, Shaiyr’s sister urged her and her husband to open their own snack bar on a major road to sell shish kebabs.  Shaiyr took her sister’s suggestion and very soon a new snack bar appeared on the road. 

Shaiyr and her husband are happy as they have begun to earn a decent income, have successfully married off their daughter, and have bought a house! Shaiyr and her husband would like to request a loan to purchase meat in order make more shish kebab. Once the entire kebab gets sold, their next plan is to do some renovation at home. In the future, Shaiyr would like to expand her business and give her two sons the best affordable education.

Shaiyr’s other loan partners include Madanbek, Kalyiman and Maral. 

Madanbek, 37, is a father of three. He earns his and his family’s living by working as a taxi driver. Madanbek needs a loan to repair his car before it completely breaks down. His earnings depend on his car. 

Kalyiman, 48, is a mother of two. Her husband is retired but he works as a taxi driver. She works as a nurse at maternity hospital. She needs a loan to send her daughter to study in China.

Maral, 30, is a housewife with two daughters attending school. Her husband is a farmer. Maral sells milk, yoghurt and sour cream. They plan to increase their livestock population. The are requesting a loan to purchase a calf.
======================================
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy meat for shish kebab

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr: A. Honorine est née le 27/02/1959 à Lomé, Capitale du Togo, pays voisin du Bénin. Honorine a fait le cours primaire et est mariée à DJIWANOU Félix, un revendeur. Honorine et son mari ont cinq enfants. La famille vit à Tokpégbé à Cotonou, Capitale Économique  de la République du Bénin. . C’est le mari d’Honorine qui assure les charges du foyer. C’est du pain que vend Honorine à la place le Bélier à Cotonou Honorine a déjà bénéficié de quatre crédits de la part de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a bien remboursées et avec quoi elle a pu relever le niveau de son activité. Honorine sollicite son cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de satisfaire la demande croissante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
A. Honorine was born on February 27, 1959 in Lomé, the capital of Togo, a country bordering Benin.  Honorine has gone to elementary school and is married to DJIWANOU Félix, a storekeeper.  She and her husband have five children.  The family lives in Tokpégbé in Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin.  Honorine's husband is the one who ensure that household expenses are covered.  Honorine sells bread at Place le Bélier in Cotonou.  She has already benefited from four loans from ALIDé that she has repaid.  She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business.  She's requesting her fifth loan for bolstering her working capital in order to satisfy the growing demands of her customers.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bread

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 33-year-old married man with 1 child. He has been working as an electrician since 1992. After this long experience in the field, Mohamad is requesting to borrow US$ 1,200 to buy new tools so he can satisfy the demands of the market and help increase his income.

loans.use: buy new tools

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: BilA. is a 24-year-old single man living with his parents. In 2007, he decided to open his own business as a water distributor to earn income to satisfy his needs. Today, BilA. is requesting to borrow US$ 800 to buy merchandise to increase his sales.

loans.use: buy merchandise

loans.name: Souad

texts.en: Souad is a 46-year-old widowed woman. After the death of her husband, she decided to open a clothes shop to provide for her needs. Souad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase additionA. merchandise to increase her sales and income.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Rissicatou

texts.fr: B. Rissicatou est née le 18/02/1962 à Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Rissicatou est mariée à LALY Houdossoudé, un soudeur. Rissicatou et son mari ont cinq enfants. La famille vit depuis dix sept ans à Pk10 à Cotonou. C’est Rissicatou et son mari qui supporte les charges de la famille. Rissicatou est dans la restauration. Rissicatou vend aussi de poissons frits. C’est au port de pêche de Cotonou que Rissicatou achète ses poissons. Rissicatou a déjà quinze ans d’expérience dans la restauration et la vente poissons frits. Rissicatou a déjà bénéficié de deux crédits de ALIDé ; crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés. Aujourd’hui, Rissicatou sollicite un troisième crédit d’ALIDé pour renforcer son fonds de roulement pour faire ses achats en gros.

loans.use: Achat de condiments de cuisine et de poissons

loans.name: Colette

texts.en: Colette has owned a beauty shop selling makeup and beauty products since 2002. She is a 42-year-old woman living with her parents. In order to develop her business and attract more clients, Colette is requesting a loan of $1,200 to purchase additional merchandise.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en: Wissam is a 30-year-old married man and father of one child. He has owned a car repair shop since 1997. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his family needs. Today, Wissam is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more tools to satisfy the demands of his clients.

loans.use: buy more tools

loans.name: Diama

texts.fr: diama T. est parent bénéficiaire depuis 1997.elle géré une boutique depuis cinq ans dans son quartier a camberene.elle sollicite un crédit de cent cinquante mille(150 000)frs pour renforcer son fond de roulement pour ainsi accroitre son stock a vendre.ses bénéfices lui permettent de participer activement a l'entretien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Diama T. has been a recipient parent since 1997.  She's been running a store for five years in her district of Camberene.  She's requesting a loan of 150,000 francs for bolstering her working capital and thus for growing her stock of goods to sell.  Her profits allow her to help care actively for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Roxana Beatriz

texts.es:
Roxana Beatriz A. Vivar vive en el municipio de Ciudad Arce departamento de La Libertad.  Su vida no es nada fácil, pues al ser madre soltera, cuida todos los días de sus dos hijos, Orlando de 5 años y Beatriz de 7 años respectivamente.
Los gastos de Roxana aumentan cada día, y cada vez le es más distribuir su tiempo en su negocio y el cuido de sus hijos. El negocio de Roxana es una venta de ropa y en esta oportunidad solicita un préstamo, para comprar ropa de niños para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Roxana lives in the city of Arce in the department of La Libertad. She doesn’t have an easy life. She is a single mother that cares for her two children every day. Orlando is five years old and Beatrice is seven years old. Roxana’s expenses increase each day and each day she needs to share her time between her business and the care of her children. Roxana’s business is selling clothes. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that she can buy children’s clothes thereby increasing her inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Aïssatou Ibra

texts.fr: Aïssatou Ibra D. est une femme de 58 ans, mariée et mère d’un enfant. Elle fait du commerce et  vend des draps et des tissus. Elle sollicite ce prêt pour renforcer ses capacités d’autofinancement. Avec ses revenus elle souhaite améliorer les conditions de vie et de santé de sa famille.
texts.en:
Aïssatou Ibra D. is a 58-year-old woman who is married and the mother of one child.  She has a business and sells bed sheets and cloth.  She's requesting this loan to bolster her ability to self-finance.  With her revenues, she wishes to improve her family's health and living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce in bed sheets and fabrics

loans.name: Cecilia Orellana

texts.es: Cecilia Orellana G. vive en el municipio de Ciudad Arce departamento de La Libertad. A sus 58 años, aun trabaja diariamente para mantener su casa que comparte con sus dos hijos.  A pesar de la avanzada edad de Cecilia, ella nunca ha dejado de trabajar por sus hijos, y es su sueño darles a ellos la posibilidad de un futuro mejor. Cecilia posee su propio negocio de ventas de cosméticos como perfumes, cremas humectantes entre otros, ahora  solicita un préstamo para comprar mercadería nueva y surtir su negocio.

loans.use: Surtir su negocio

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama M. est âgée de 40 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active dans le commerce de produits de beauté. Ce prêt lui permettra de participer en partie aux charges familiales et d’améliorer leurs conditions de vie et de santé.

loans.use: Vente de produits de beauté

loans.name: Aboubakar

texts.fr: A. Aboubakar est un jeune homme agée de 20 ans célibataire sans enfant. Il habite et travaille à Adéta, une ville située à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale du Togo. Avec son frère marié avec un enfant, il gère ensemble une boutique d’alimentation générale. Suite à la demande excessive de ces produits, Il veut augmenter la quantité de l’approvisionnement en achetant en gros afin d’avoir plus de bénéfice. Avec ces bénéfices il voudrait bien ouvrir une autre boutique et assurer d’une meilleure manière sa santé.
texts.en:
A. Aboubakar is a 20 year old young man who is single and without children. He lives and works in Adéta, a town located about 150 kilometers (approximately 93 miles) from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Together with his brother, who is married with one child, he runs a general food store. Following the excessive demand for his products, he wants to increase the quantities of his supplies by buying bulk in order to have a larger profit. With these profits he would like to open another store and ensure his health in a better manner.

Translated from French by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase general food products in bulk

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es: María Del Rosario  M. vive en el departamento de La Libertad, en la costa del país. María maneja por sí misma una pequeña tienda de productos de belleza y ropa. El manejo de la venta lo hace siempre acompañada de su hijita menor de edad. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para reinvertir en su negocio y comprar nuevos productos para vender, pues busca firmemente salir adelante y ser cada día una mejor persona.
texts.en:
María Del Rosario M. lives in province of La Libertad, on the country’s coast. María runs a small beauty product and clothing store all by herself. The way she works has allowed her to always be with her younger sister. Now she is soliciting a loan to reinvest in her business and buy new products to sell. She is always looking to advance and strives daily to be a better person.

Translated from Spanish by Emma Felten, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: restock her business

loans.name: Irma Yanira

texts.es: Irma Yanira O. D. L. vive en el departamento D. La Libertad.  Junto a su esposo han puesto una tienda en su casa ademas Irma tiene una venta D. productos D. belleza por catalogo. A sus cortos 30 años, Yanira tiene ya tres hijos, todos menores D. edad que estudian en el colegio. Lo difícil D. la situación económica y los crecientes gastos del colegio D. sus hijos, llenan a Yanira D. un enorme deseo D. superación, y es por eso que solicita un préstamo para ampliar su negocio y comprar nuevos productos que potencien su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Irma Yanira O. D. L. lives in the district of La Libertad. Together with her husband, they manage a store out of their home. Yanira also sells beauty products by catalog. At 30 years of age, Yanira already has 3 children who attend school. The difficult economic situation and the rising cost of her children’s education have motivated Yanira to excel in her businesses. For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can expand her business and buy new products to help generate more revenue.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise to restock her business

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi E. est un homme de 35 ans marié et père de  trois enfants. Il habite à AVENO, un village situé  environ 90 kilomètres de Kpalimé.  Avec ce prêt, komi voudrait acheter une moto pour en faire TAXI. Le travail de Komi consiste à faire monter les passagers sur la moto et les faire déposer à leur destination et prend les frais de déplacement. Avec ce premier crédit de FECECAV, il veut améliorer sa vie en envoyant ses trois enfants à l’école.
texts.en:
Komi E. is a 35-year-old man who is married and the father of three children. He lives in AVENO, a village located about 90 km from Kpalimé. With this loan, Komi would like to buy a moto, a motorbike serving as a taxi. His work involves having passengers climb onto his motorbike, dropping them off at their destination, and charging a fee for the trip. With this initial FECECAV loan, he wants to improve his life by sending his three children to school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a taxi-moto

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine M. is 36 years old and married with three children aged 18, 17, and 12 years. All her children go to school. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in an urban area. She incurs extra transport to and from shopping.

Christine deals in onions from Owino market which is one of the busiest markets in Kampala and does her shopping twice a week. She sells to 20 customers a day and sells to all categories of people 6 days a week. She has been in this business for the last ten years. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence plus school fees.

Christine has been with MCDT for 5 years servicing her 12th loan, working with the same groupmates. She wants to use this loan to increase her stock of onions. Her major challenges are the ever increasing prices and heavy rains during the rainy season. Her aspirations are to see her business grow.

loans.use: To buy more onions to sell.

loans.name: Saeda

texts.en: Saeda is a 40 year old single woman living with her parents. She has owned a food market in her town since 2008. Today, Saeda is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise so she can increase her sales and therefore her income.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Khodor

texts.en: Khodor is a 31-year-old married man with 2 children. He has owned a car repair shop since 2000 to satisfy the needs of his family. Today, Khodor is requesting a loan of $1,000 to renovate the tools and expand his shop to attract more clients.

loans.use: renovate the tools and expand his shop

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes R. vive en el municipio de Armenia departamento Sonsonate.  A sus 69 años de edad continua trabajando y alberga en su casa a su hija ya mayor y sus nietos.
Desde ya hace varios años atrás, Mercedes administra una tienda y panadería ubicada en su propia casa, esta tienda se ha convertido en un espacio de recreación para sus nietos, a quienes cuida durante el día, mientras la madre de los niños trabaja. Mercedes solicita un préstamo para comprar cereales y bebidas para ampliar la mercadería de su panadería y aportar más a su extensa familia.
texts.en:
Mercedes R. lives in the town of Armenia, which is in the district of Sonsonate. At 69 years of age, she continues to work. She lives with her oldest daughter and her grandchildren.

Several years ago, Mercedes managed a grocery store and bakery from her own home. Since then the store has been converted into a recreational space for her grandchildren, whom she takes care of during the day while their mother is at work. Mercedes is requesting a loan to buy grains and beverages to increase the merchandise offered in her bakery so that she can provide additional support to her extended family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock her business

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es: Orlando R. Z. vive en Armenia municipio del departamento de Sonsonate. Orlando siempre ha sido un joven soñador y emprendedor, y a pesar de tener tan solo 32 años es ya cabeza de su familia, y mantiene a su esposa y dos hijos. El negocio familiar es una panadería que administran en su propia casa, y donde trabajan y colaboran todos los miembros de la familia Z.. Orlando solicita un préstamo para comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima, para hacer crecer su negocio familiar cada vez un poco más.
texts.en:
Orlando R. Z. lives in the town of Armenia, which is in the district of Sonsonate. He has always dreamed of becoming an entrepreneur. At 32 years of age, he is the head of his family and supports his wife and two children. His bakery is a family operated business that he manages from his home. Every member of the Z. family works in the business and helps one another. Orlando is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients in bulk so that he can grow his family business a little more each time.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 24 year old engaged man.

He has been working as a home-based calligrapher since 2007 to provide, along with his brothers, better living conditions for the family. Today, Mohamad wants to borrow $700 to open his own shop and improve his income.

loans.use: Open his own shop.

loans.name: Berna

texts.en: Berna is a 39 year married with five children aged 20, 18, 16, 14 and 17 years.  She resides and rents a two roomed house and all her children go to school. Berna takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and no piped water at her home.  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in an urban area.   She incurs extra transport to and from shopping   .She operates a retail shop with general merchandise from Kikuubo market. She sells to 20 customers a day.and sells to all categories of people.  Berna sells varieties of household goods and works seven days a week. Her major monthly expenses include rent for business and residence, school fees plus medication. She has been in this business for the last ten years Beran has been with MCDT for five years servicing her fourteenth loan, working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to stock more merchandise and be able to serve a variety of customers. Berna wants to see her business grow bigger

loans.use: To increase stock of merchandise in her retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Achat de l'aluminium
